[She]2056-the signora promised [us]2057-us [south rooms]2058-south rooms with a view close together , instead of which [here]2059-here are [north rooms]2060-north rooms , looking into [a courtyard]2061-a courtyard , and a long way apart . Oh , [Lucy]112-lucy ! "[111-miss bartlett]

" [I]112-lucy want so to see [the Arno]2-the arno . [Lucy]112-lucy felt that [she]112-lucy had been selfish . " No , no . [You]112-lucy must have it . "[112-lucy]

[The ladies]300-the ladies ' voices grew animated , and - if the sad truth be owned - a little peevish . [They]300-the ladies were tired , and under the guise of unselfishness [they]300-the ladies wrangled . [Some of [[their]300-the ladies neighbours]302-their neighbours]301-some of their neighbours interchanged glances , and [one of [them]301-some of their neighbours]303-one of them - one of [the ill - bred people whom one does meet abroad]304-the ill - bred people whom one does meet abroad - leant forward over the table and actually intruded into [their]300-the ladies argument . [He]303-one of them said :

" [I]303-one of them have a view , [I]303-one of them have a view . "[303-one of them]

[Miss Bartlett]111-miss bartlett was startled . Generally at a pension [people]305-people looked [them]305-people over for a day or two before speaking , and often did not find out that [they]305-people would " do "[306-the intruder] till [they]305-people had gone . [She]111-miss bartlett knew that [the intruder]306-the intruder was ill - bred , even before [she]111-miss bartlett glanced at [him]306-the intruder . [He]306-the intruder was [an old man , of heavy build , with a fair , shaven face and large eyes]307-an old man , of heavy build , with a fair , shaven face and large eyes . There was something childish in those eyes , though it was not the childishness of senility . What exactly it was [Miss Bartlett]111-miss bartlett did not stop to consider , for [her]111-miss bartlett glance passed on to [his]306-the intruder clothes . These did not attract [her]111-miss bartlett . [He]306-the intruder was probably trying to become acquainted with [them]308-them before [they]308-them got into [the swim]309-the swim . So [she]111-miss bartlett assumed a dazed expression when [he]306-the intruder spoke to [her]111-miss bartlett , and then said : " A view ? Oh , a view ! How delightful a view is ! "[111-miss bartlett]

[He]306-the intruder did not look at [the ladies]300-the ladies as [he]306-the intruder spoke , but [his]306-the intruder voice was perplexed and sorrowful . Now [the old man]310-the old man attacked [Miss Bartlett]111-miss bartlett almost violently : Why should [she]111-miss bartlett not change ? What possible objection had [she]111-miss bartlett ? [They]300-the ladies would clear out in half an hour .

[Miss Bartlett]111-miss bartlett , though skilled in the delicacies of conversation , was powerless in the presence of brutality . It was impossible to snub [any one so gross]322-any one so gross . [Her]111-miss bartlett face reddened with displeasure . [She]111-miss bartlett looked around as much as to say , " Are [you]300-the ladies all like this ? "[111-miss bartlett]

Hardly had [she]112-lucy announced this fell decision when [she]112-lucy reversed it . [He]116-mr. beebe preferred to talk to [Lucy]112-lucy , whose playing [he]116-mr. beebe remembered , rather than to [Miss Bartlett]111-miss bartlett , who probably remembered [his]116-mr. beebe sermons . [He]116-mr. beebe asked [the girl]333-the girl whether [she]333-the girl knew [Florence]14-florence well , and was informed at some length that [she]333-the girl had never been [there]334-there before . " [That lady]2092-that lady looks so clever , "[111-miss bartlett] whispered [Miss Bartlett]111-miss bartlett to [[her]111-miss bartlett cousin]314-her cousin . " [We]338-them are in luck . "[111-miss bartlett]

And , indeed , a perfect torrent of information burst on [them]338-them . [People]305-people told [them]338-them what to see , when to see it , how to stop [the electric trams]340-the electric trams , how to get rid of [the beggars]341-the beggars , how much to give for a vellum blotter , how much [the place]342-the place would grow upon [them]338-them . [The Pension Bertolini]110-the bertolini had decided , almost enthusiastically , that [they]338-them would do . Whichever way [they]338-them looked , [kind ladies]343-kind ladies smiled and shouted at [them]338-them . And above all rose the voice of [the clever lady]344-the clever lady , crying : " [Prato]9-prato ! [They]338-them must go to [Prato]9-prato . [That place]2093-that place is too sweetly squalid for words . [I]344-the clever lady love [it]2093-that place ; [I]344-the clever lady revel in shaking off the trammels of respectability , as [you]345-the young man know . "[344-the clever lady]

[The young man]345-the young man named [George]115-george glanced at [the clever lady]344-the clever lady , and then returned moodily to [his]345-the young man plate . Obviously [he]345-the young man and [[his]345-the young man father]347-his father did not do . [Lucy]112-lucy , in the midst of [her]112-lucy success , found time to wish [they]348-they did . It gave [her]112-lucy no extra pleasure that [any one]349-any one should be left in the cold ; and when [she]112-lucy rose to go , [she]112-lucy turned back and gave [the two outsiders]350-the two outsiders a nervous little bow .

[The father]351-the father did not see it ; [the son]317-the son acknowledged it , not by another bow , but by raising [his]317-the son eyebrows and smiling ; [he]317-the son seemed to be smiling across something .

[She]112-lucy hastened after [[her]112-lucy cousin]314-her cousin , who had already disappeared through the curtains - curtains which smote one in the face , and seemed heavy with more than cloth . Beyond [them]348-they stood the unreliable [Signora]113-the signora , bowing good - evening to [[her]113-the signora guests]354-her guests , and supported by ' [Enery]118-enery , [[her]113-the signora little boy]355-her little boy , and [Victorier]119-victorier , [[her]113-the signora daughter]356-her daughter . It made a curious little scene , this attempt of [the Cockney]357-the cockney to convey the grace and geniality of [the South]10-the south . And even more curious was [the drawing - room]358-the drawing - room , which attempted to rival the solid comfort of [a Bloomsbury boarding - house]359-a bloomsbury boarding - house . Was this really [Italy]11-italy ?

[Miss Bartlett]111-miss bartlett was already seated on a tightly stuffed arm - chair , which had the colour and the contours of a tomato . [She]111-miss bartlett was talking to [Mr. Beebe]116-mr. beebe , and as [she]111-miss bartlett spoke , [her]111-miss bartlett long narrow head drove backwards and forwards , slowly , regularly , as though [she]111-miss bartlett were demolishing some invisible obstacle . " [We]2094-we are most grateful to [you]116-mr. beebe , "[111-miss bartlett] [she]111-miss bartlett was saying . " The first evening means so much . For [she]112-lucy was determined to enjoy [herself]112-lucy on the morrow . Thus the half - hour crept profitably away , and at last [Miss Bartlett]111-miss bartlett rose with a sigh , and said :

" [I]111-miss bartlett think one might venture now . No , [Lucy]112-lucy , do not stir . [I]111-miss bartlett will superintend the move . "[111-miss bartlett]

[Charlotte]111-miss bartlett 's energy ! And [her]111-miss bartlett unselfishness ! [She]111-miss bartlett had been thus all [her]111-miss bartlett life , but really , on this Italian tour , [she]111-miss bartlett was surpassing [herself]111-miss bartlett . So [Lucy]112-lucy felt , or strove to feel . And yet - there was a rebellious spirit in [her]112-lucy which wondered whether the acceptance might not have been less delicate and more beautiful . At all events , [she]112-lucy entered [[her]112-lucy own room]393-her own room without any feeling of joy .

" [I]111-miss bartlett want to explain , "[111-miss bartlett] said [Miss Bartlett]111-miss bartlett , " why it is that [I]111-miss bartlett have taken [the largest room]2148-the largest room . "[111-miss bartlett]

" [Mother]123-mother would n't mind [I]112-lucy 'm sure , "[112-lucy] said [Lucy]112-lucy , but again had the sense of larger and unsuspected issues .

[Miss Bartlett]111-miss bartlett only sighed , and enveloped [her]112-lucy in a protecting embrace as [she]111-miss bartlett wished [her]112-lucy good - night . It gave [Lucy]112-lucy the sensation of a fog , and when [she]112-lucy reached [[her]112-lucy own room]393-her own room [she]112-lucy opened the window and breathed the clean night air , thinking of [the kind old man who had enabled [her]112-lucy to see the lights dancing in [the Arno]2-the arno and the cypresses of [San Miniato]24-san miniato]395-the kind old man who had enabled her to see the lights dancing in the arno and the cypresses of san miniato , and [the foot - hills of [the Apennines]18-the apennines]396-the foot - hills of the apennines , black against the rising moon .

[Miss Bartlett]111-miss bartlett , in [[her]111-miss bartlett room]397-her room , fastened the window - shutters and locked the door , and then made a tour of [the apartment]391-the apartment to see where the cupboards led , and whether there were any oubliettes or secret entrances . It was then that [she]111-miss bartlett saw , pinned up over the washstand , a sheet of paper on which was scrawled an enormous note of interrogation . Nothing more .

" What does it mean ? "[111-miss bartlett] [she]111-miss bartlett thought , and [she]111-miss bartlett examined it carefully by the light of a candle . Meaningless at first , it gradually became menacing , obnoxious , portentous with evil . [She]111-miss bartlett was seized with an impulse to destroy it , but fortunately remembered that [she]111-miss bartlett had no right to do so , since it must be the property of [young Mr. Emerson]115-george . So [she]111-miss bartlett unpinned it carefully , and put it between two pieces of blotting - paper to keep it clean for [him]115-george . Then [she]111-miss bartlett completed [her]111-miss bartlett inspection of [the room]325-the room , sighed heavily according to [her]111-miss bartlett habit , and went to bed .

Chapter II : In [Santa Croce]19-santa croce with [No Baedeker]122-baedeker

It was pleasant to wake up in [Florence]14-florence , to open the eyes upon [a bright bare room]400-a bright bare room , with a floor of red tiles which look clean though they are not ; with a painted ceiling whereon pink griffins and blue [amorini sport in a forest of yellow violins and bassoons]401-amorini sport in a forest of yellow violins and bassoons . It was pleasant , too , to fling wide the windows , pinching the fingers in unfamiliar fastenings , to lean out into sunshine with beautiful hills and trees and [marble churches]402-marble churches opposite , and close below , [the Arno]2-the arno , gurgling against [the embankment of [the road]404-the road]403-the embankment of the road .

Over [the river]405-the river [men]2073-men were at work with spades and sieves on [the sandy foreshore]407-the sandy foreshore , and on [the river]405-the river was [a boat]409-a boat , also diligently employed for some mysterious end . [An electric tram]410-an electric tram came rushing underneath the window . [No one]2114-no one was inside [it]410-an electric tram , except [one tourist]412-one tourist ; but [its]410-an electric tram platforms were overflowing with [Italians]124-italians , who preferred to stand . [Children]413-children tried to hang on behind , and [the conductor]414-the conductor , with no malice , spat in [their]413-children faces to make [them]413-children let go . Then [soldiers]415-soldiers appeared - [good - looking , undersized men]416-good - looking , undersized men - wearing each a knapsack covered with mangy fur , and a great - coat which had been cut for [some larger soldier]417-some larger soldier . Beside [them]415-soldiers walked [officers]418-officers , looking foolish and fierce , and before [them]415-soldiers went [little boys , turning somersaults in time with the band]419-little boys , turning somersaults in time with the band . [The tramcar]420-the tramcar became entangled in [their]415-soldiers ranks , and moved on painfully , like a caterpillar in a swarm of ants . [One of [the little boys]422-the little boys]421-one of the little boys fell down , and some white bullocks came out of an archway . Indeed , if it had not been for the good advice of [an old man who was selling button - hooks]423-an old man who was selling button - hooks , [the road]404-the road might never have got clear .

Over such trivialities as these many a valuable hour may slip away , and [the traveller who has gone to [Italy]11-italy to study the tactile values of [Giotto]136-giotto , or the corruption of [the Papacy]21-the papacy]425-the traveller who has gone to italy to study the tactile values of giotto , or the corruption of the papacy , may return remembering nothing but the blue sky and the men and [women who live under it]426-women who live under it . So it was as well that [Miss Bartlett]111-miss bartlett should tap and come in , and having commented on [Lucy]112-lucy 's leaving the door unlocked , and on [her]112-lucy leaning out of the window before [she]112-lucy was fully dressed , should urge [her]112-lucy to hasten [herself]112-lucy , or the best of the day would be gone . By the time [Lucy]112-lucy was ready [[her]112-lucy cousin]314-her cousin had done [her]314-her cousin breakfast , and was listening to [the clever lady among the crumbs]428-the clever lady among the crumbs .

A conversation then ensued , on not unfamiliar lines . [Miss Bartlett]111-miss bartlett was , after all , a wee bit tired , and thought [they]429-they had better spend the morning settling in ; unless [Lucy]112-lucy would at all like to go out ? [Lucy]112-lucy would rather like to go out , as it was [her]112-lucy first day in [Florence]14-florence , but , of course , [she]112-lucy could go alone . [Miss Bartlett]111-miss bartlett could not allow this . Of course [she]111-miss bartlett would accompany [Lucy]112-lucy everywhere . Oh , certainly not ; [Lucy]112-lucy would stop with [[her]112-lucy cousin]314-her cousin . Oh , no ! that would never do . Oh , yes !

At this point [the clever lady]344-the clever lady broke in .

" If it is [Mrs. Grundy]125-mrs. grundy who is troubling [you]112-lucy , [I]344-the clever lady do assure [you]112-lucy that [you]112-lucy can neglect [the good person]2155-the good person . Being English , [Miss Honeychurch]112-lucy will be perfectly safe . [Italians]124-italians understand . " [[My]310-the old man dear]2116-my dear , "[310-the old man] said [the old man]310-the old man gently , " [I]310-the old man think that [you]2116-my dear are repeating what [you]2116-my dear have heard [older people]2216-older people say . " Remember , "[115-george] [he]115-george was saying , " the facts about [this church of [Santa Croce]19-santa croce]2218-this church of santa croce ; how [it]2218-this church of santa croce was built by faith in the full fervour of medievalism , before any taint of the Renaissance had appeared . Could anything be more majestic , more pathetic , beautiful , true ? How little , [we]2220-we feel , avails knowledge and technical cleverness against [a man who truly feels]2221-a man who truly feels ! "[115-george]

" No ! "[115-george] exclaimed [Mr. Emerson]115-george , in much too loud a voice for [church]525-church . " Remember nothing of the sort ! Built by faith indeed ! [He]115-george was referring to the fresco of the " Ascension of [St. John]142-st. john . "[115-george] Inside , [the lecturer]526-the lecturer 's voice faltered , as well it might . " Now , did this happen , or did n't it ? Yes or no ? "[528-these men]

[George]115-george replied :

" It happened like this , if it happened at all . "[115-george]

" [You]115-george will never go up , "[347-his father] said [[his]115-george father]347-his father . " [I]565-he only know what it is that 's wrong with [him]115-george ; not why it is . "[565-he]

" The old trouble ; things wo n't fit . "[565-he]

In [his]565-he ordinary voice , so that [she]112-lucy scarcely realized [he]565-he was quoting poetry , [he]565-he said :

" ' From far , from eve and morning , And yon twelve - winded sky , The stuff of life to knit [me]565-he Blew hither : here am [I]565-he '[565-he]

[George]115-george and [I]0-i both know this , but why does it distress [him]565-he ? [Miss Honeychurch]112-lucy assented .

" [I]112-lucy 'm very sorry , "[112-lucy] [she]112-lucy cried . " [You]112-lucy 'll think [me]112-lucy unfeeling , but - but - "[112-lucy] Then [she]112-lucy became matronly . Chapter III : Music , Violets , and the Letter " S "[112-lucy]

It so happened that [Lucy]112-lucy , who found daily life rather chaotic , entered a more solid world when [she]112-lucy opened the piano . [She]112-lucy was then no longer either deferential or patronizing ; no longer either [a rebel]577-a rebel or [a slave]578-a slave . The kingdom of music is not [the kingdom of [this world]569-this world]579-the kingdom of this world ; it will accept [those whom breeding and intellect and culture have alike rejected]581-those whom breeding and intellect and culture have alike rejected . [The commonplace person]582-the commonplace person begins to play , and shoots into the empyrean without effort , whilst [we]583-we look up , marvelling how [he]582-the commonplace person has escaped [us]583-we , and thinking how [we]583-we could worship [him]582-the commonplace person and love [him]582-the commonplace person , would [he]582-the commonplace person but translate [his]582-the commonplace person visions into human words , and [his]582-the commonplace person experiences into human actions . Perhaps [he]582-the commonplace person can not ; certainly [he]582-the commonplace person does not , or does so very seldom . [Lucy]112-lucy had done so never .

[She]112-lucy was [no dazzling executante]584-no dazzling executante ; [her]112-lucy runs were not at all like strings of pearls , and [she]112-lucy struck no more right notes than was suitable for one of [her]112-lucy age and situation . Nor was [she]112-lucy [the passionate young lady]585-the passionate young lady , who performs so tragically on a summer 's evening with the window open . Passion was there , but it could not be easily labelled ; it slipped between love and hatred and jealousy , and all the furniture of the pictorial style . And [she]112-lucy was tragical only in the sense that [she]112-lucy was great , for [she]112-lucy loved to play on the side of Victory . Victory of what and over what - that is more than the words of daily life can tell [us]583-we . But that some sonatas of [Beethoven]150-beethoven are written tragic [no one]2114-no one can gainsay ; yet [they]587-they can triumph or despair as [the player]588-the player decides , and [Lucy]112-lucy had decided that [they]587-they should triumph .

A very wet afternoon at [the Bertolini]110-the bertolini permitted [her]112-lucy to do the thing [she]112-lucy really liked , and after lunch [she]112-lucy opened the little draped piano . [A few people]589-a few people lingered round and praised [her]112-lucy playing , but finding that [she]112-lucy made no reply , dispersed to [[their]589-a few people rooms]2138-their rooms to write up [their]589-a few people diaries or to sleep . [She]112-lucy took no notice of [Mr. Emerson]149-the miss alans looking for [[his]149-the miss alans son]316-his son , nor of [Miss Bartlett]111-miss bartlett looking for [Miss Lavish]128-miss lavish , nor of [Miss Lavish]128-miss lavish looking for [her]128-miss lavish cigarette - case . Like [every true performer]592-every true performer , [she]112-lucy was intoxicated by the mere feel of the notes : they were fingers caressing [her]112-lucy own ; and by touch , not by sound alone , did [she]112-lucy come to [her]112-lucy desire .

[Mr. Beebe]116-mr. beebe , sitting unnoticed in the window , pondered this illogical element in [Miss Honeychurch]112-lucy , and recalled the occasion at [Tunbridge Wells]3-tunbridge wells when [he]116-mr. beebe had discovered it . It was at one of those entertainments where [the upper classes]593-the upper classes entertain [the lower]594-the lower . The seats were filled with [a respectful audience]595-a respectful audience , and [the ladies and gentlemen of [the parish]597-the parish]596-the ladies and gentlemen of the parish , under the auspices of [[their]596-the ladies and gentlemen of the parish vicar]598-their vicar , sang , or recited , or imitated the drawing of a champagne cork . Among the promised items was " [Miss Honeychurch]112-lucy . Piano . Beethoven , "[116-mr. beebe] and [Mr. Beebe]116-mr. beebe was wondering whether it would be [Adelaida]151-adelaida , or the march of [The Ruins of [Athens]39-athens]38-the ruins of athens , when [his]116-mr. beebe composure was disturbed by the opening bars of Opus III . [He]116-mr. beebe was in suspense all through the introduction , for not until the pace quickens does [one]2064-one know what [the performer]600-the performer intends . With the roar of the opening theme [he]116-mr. beebe knew that things were going extraordinarily ; in the chords that herald the conclusion [he]116-mr. beebe heard the hammer strokes of victory . [He]116-mr. beebe was glad that [she]600-the performer only played the first movement , for [he]116-mr. beebe could have paid no attention to the winding intricacies of the measures of nine - sixteen . [The audience]527-the audience clapped , no less respectful . It was [Mr. Beebe]116-mr. beebe who started the stamping ; it was all that [one]2064-one could do .

" Who is [she]600-the performer ? "[116-mr. beebe] [he]116-mr. beebe asked [the vicar]603-the vicar afterwards .

" [Cousin of one of [[my]116-mr. beebe parishioners]2278-my parishioners]2277-cousin of one of my parishioners . [I]116-mr. beebe do not consider [her]600-the performer choice of a piece happy . [Beethoven]150-beethoven is so usually simple and direct in [his]150-beethoven appeal that it is sheer perversity to choose a thing like that , which , if anything , disturbs . "[116-mr. beebe]

" Introduce [me]116-mr. beebe . "[116-mr. beebe]

" [She]600-the performer will be delighted . [She]600-the performer and [Miss Bartlett]111-miss bartlett are full of the praises of [your]116-mr. beebe sermon . "[116-mr. beebe]

" [My]116-mr. beebe sermon ? "[116-mr. beebe] cried [Mr. Beebe]116-mr. beebe . " Why ever did [she]600-the performer listen to it ? "[116-mr. beebe]

When [he]116-mr. beebe was introduced [he]116-mr. beebe understood why , for [Miss Honeychurch]112-lucy , disjoined from [her]112-lucy music stool , was only [a young lady with a quantity of dark hair and a very pretty , pale , undeveloped face]604-a young lady with a quantity of dark hair and a very pretty , pale , undeveloped face . [She]112-lucy loved going to concerts , [she]112-lucy loved stopping with [[her]112-lucy cousin]314-her cousin , [she]112-lucy loved iced coffee and meringues . [He]116-mr. beebe did not doubt that [she]112-lucy loved [his]116-mr. beebe sermon also . But before [he]116-mr. beebe left [Tunbridge Wells]3-tunbridge wells [he]116-mr. beebe made a remark to [the vicar]603-the vicar , which [he]116-mr. beebe now made to [Lucy]112-lucy [herself]112-lucy when [she]112-lucy closed the little piano and moved dreamily towards [him]116-mr. beebe :

" If [Miss Honeychurch]112-lucy ever takes to live as [she]112-lucy plays , it will be very exciting both for [us]2279-us and for [her]112-lucy . "[112-lucy]

[Lucy]112-lucy at once re - entered daily life .

" Oh , what a funny thing ! [Some one]454-some one said just the same to [mother]2081-mother , and [she]2081-mother said [she]2081-mother trusted [I]112-lucy should never live a duet . "[112-lucy]

" Does n't [Mrs. Honeychurch]152-mrs. honeychurch like music ? "[112-lucy]

" [She]112-lucy does n't mind it . But [she]112-lucy does n't like one to get excited over anything ; [she]112-lucy thinks [I]112-lucy am silly about it . [She]112-lucy thinks - [I]112-lucy ca n't make out . Once , [you]2282-you know , [I]112-lucy said that [I]112-lucy liked [my]112-lucy own playing better than [any one]349-any one 's . [She]112-lucy has never got over it . Of course , [I]112-lucy did n't mean that [I]112-lucy played well ; [I]112-lucy only meant - "[112-lucy]

" Of course , "[607-he] said [he]607-he , wondering why [she]608-she bothered to explain .

" Music - "[112-lucy] said [Lucy]112-lucy , as if attempting some generality . [She]112-lucy could not complete it , and looked out absently upon [Italy]11-italy in the wet . The whole life of [the South]10-the south was disorganized , and [the most graceful nation in [Europe]272-europe]609-the most graceful nation in europe had turned into formless lumps of clothes .

[The street]610-the street and [the river]405-the river were dirty yellow , [the bridge]612-the bridge was dirty grey , and [the hills]613-the hills were dirty purple . Somewhere in [their]614-their folds were concealed [Miss Lavish]128-miss lavish and [Miss Bartlett]111-miss bartlett , who had chosen this afternoon to visit [the Torre del Gallo]615-the torre del gallo .

" What about music ? "[116-mr. beebe] said [Mr. Beebe]116-mr. beebe .

" [Poor Charlotte]153-poor charlotte will be sopped , "[112-lucy] was [Lucy]112-lucy 's reply .

The expedition was typical of [Miss Bartlett]111-miss bartlett , who would return cold , tired , hungry , and angelic , with a ruined skirt , [a pulpy Baedeker]122-baedeker , and a tickling cough in [her]111-miss bartlett throat . " [Miss Lavish]128-miss lavish has led [[your]112-lucy cousin]2284-your cousin astray . [She]128-miss lavish hopes to find the true [Italy]11-italy in the wet [I]111-miss bartlett believe . "[111-miss bartlett]

" [Miss Lavish]128-miss lavish is so original , "[112-lucy] murmured [Lucy]112-lucy . "[116-mr. beebe]

" [I]112-lucy wish [Miss Lavish]128-miss lavish would tell [me]112-lucy [herself]128-miss lavish . [We]2286-we started [such friends]2287-such friends . " [The two ladies]2288-the two ladies , at all events , have made it up . "[620-he]

[He]620-he was interested in the sudden friendship between women so apparently dissimilar as [Miss Bartlett]111-miss bartlett and [Miss Lavish]128-miss lavish . [They]621-they were always in each other 's company , with [Lucy]112-lucy a slighted third . [[Girls]624-girls like [Lucy]112-lucy]625-girls like lucy were charming to look at , but [Mr. Beebe]116-mr. beebe was , from rather profound reasons , somewhat chilly in [his]116-mr. beebe attitude towards the other sex , and preferred to be interested rather than enthralled .

[Lucy]112-lucy , for the third time , said that poor [Charlotte]111-miss bartlett would be sopped . [Mr. Beebe]116-mr. beebe smiled nonchalantly . [He]116-mr. beebe had made a gentle effort to introduce [the Emersons]642-the emersons into [Bertolini society]643-bertolini society , and the effort had failed . [He]116-mr. beebe was almost [the only person who remained friendly to [them]642-the emersons]644-the only person who remained friendly to them . [Miss Lavish]128-miss lavish , who represented intellect , was avowedly hostile , and now [the Miss Alans , who stood for good breeding]645-the miss alans , who stood for good breeding , were following [her]128-miss lavish . [Miss Bartlett]111-miss bartlett , smarting under an obligation , would scarcely be civil . The case of [Lucy]112-lucy was different . [She]112-lucy had given [him]116-mr. beebe a hazy account of [her]112-lucy adventures in [Santa Croce]19-santa croce , and [he]116-mr. beebe gathered that [the two men]646-the two men had made a curious and possibly concerted attempt to annex [her]112-lucy , to show [her]112-lucy [the world]2079-the world from [their]646-the two men own strange standpoint , to interest [her]112-lucy in [their]646-the two men private sorrows and joys . [Lucy]112-lucy , with one eye upon the weather , finally said that [she]112-lucy thought [the Emersons]141-the emersons were nice ; not that [she]112-lucy saw anything of [them]141-the emersons now . Even [their]141-the emersons seats at dinner had been moved .

" Only once . [Charlotte]111-miss bartlett did n't like it , and said something - quite politely , of course . "[650-the little lady]

" Most right of [her]111-miss bartlett . [They]141-the emersons do n't understand [our]141-the emersons ways . [They]141-the emersons must find [their]141-the emersons level . "[650-the little lady]

[Mr. Beebe]116-mr. beebe rather felt that [they]141-the emersons had gone under . [They]141-the emersons had given up [their]141-the emersons attempt - if it was one - to conquer society , and now [the father]351-the father was almost as silent as [the son]317-the son . [He]116-mr. beebe wondered whether [he]116-mr. beebe would not plan a pleasant day for [these folk]653-these folk before [they]141-the emersons left - some expedition , perhaps , with [Lucy]112-lucy well chaperoned to be nice to [them]141-the emersons . It was one of [Mr. Beebe]116-mr. beebe 's chief pleasures to provide [people]305-people with happy memories .

Evening approached while [they]141-the emersons chatted ; the air became brighter ; the colours on the trees and [hills]655-hills were purified , and [the Arno]2-the arno lost its muddy solidity and began to twinkle . There were a few streaks of bluish - green among the clouds , a few patches of watery light upon the earth , and then the dripping facade of [San Miniato]24-san miniato shone brilliantly in the declining sun .

" Too late to go out , "[144-miss alan] said [Miss Alan]144-miss alan in a voice of relief . " [All the galleries]2341-all the galleries are shut . "[144-miss alan]

" [I]112-lucy think [I]112-lucy shall go out , "[112-lucy] said [Lucy]112-lucy . " [I]112-lucy want to go round [the town]2342-the town in [the circular tram]2343-the circular tram - on the platform by [the driver]2165-the driver . "[112-lucy]

[[Her]112-lucy two companions]656-her two companions looked grave . [Mr. Beebe]116-mr. beebe , who felt responsible for [her]112-lucy in the absence of [Miss Bartlett]111-miss bartlett , ventured to say :

" [She]112-lucy ought n't really to go at all , "[116-mr. beebe] said [Mr. Beebe]116-mr. beebe , as [they]656-her two companions watched [her]112-lucy from the window , " and [she]112-lucy knows it . [I]116-mr. beebe put it down to too much [Beethoven]150-beethoven . "[116-mr. beebe]

Chapter IV : Fourth Chapter

[Mr. Beebe]116-mr. beebe was right . [Lucy]112-lucy never knew [her]112-lucy desires so clearly as after music . [She]112-lucy had not really appreciated [the clergyman]332-the clergyman 's wit , nor the suggestive twitterings of [Miss Alan]144-miss alan . Conversation was tedious ; [she]112-lucy wanted something big , and [she]112-lucy believed that it would have come to [her]112-lucy on the wind - swept platform of [an electric tram]410-an electric tram . This [she]112-lucy might not attempt . It was unladylike . Why ? Why were most big things unladylike ? [Charlotte]111-miss bartlett had once explained to [her]112-lucy why . It was not that [ladies]661-ladies were inferior to [men]2073-men ; it was that [they]661-ladies were different . [Their]661-ladies mission was to inspire [others]663-others to achievement rather than to achieve [themselves]661-ladies . [Indirectly]160-indirectly , by means of tact and a spotless name , [a lady]664-a lady could accomplish much . But if [she]112-lucy rushed into the fray [herself]112-lucy [she]112-lucy would be first censured , then despised , and finally ignored . Poems had been written to illustrate this point .

There is much that is immortal in [this medieval lady]665-this medieval lady . The dragons have gone , and so have [the knights]666-the knights , but still [she]112-lucy lingers in [our]667-our midst . [She]112-lucy reigned in many [an early Victorian castle]668-an early victorian castle , and was [Queen of much early Victorian song]669-queen of much early victorian song . It is sweet to protect [her]112-lucy in the intervals of business , sweet to pay [her]112-lucy honour when [she]112-lucy has cooked [our]667-our dinner well . But alas ! the creature grows degenerate . In [her]112-lucy heart also there are springing up strange desires . [She]112-lucy too is enamoured of heavy winds , and vast panoramas , and green expanses of [the sea]670-the sea . [She]112-lucy has marked [the kingdom of [this world]569-this world]579-the kingdom of this world , how full [it]579-the kingdom of this world is of wealth , and beauty , and war - a radiant crust , built around the central fires , spinning towards the receding heavens . [Men]2073-men , declaring that [she]112-lucy inspires [them]2073-men to it , move joyfully over the surface , having the most delightful meetings with [other men]674-other men , happy , not because [they]674-other men are masculine , but because [they]674-other men are alive . Before the show breaks up [she]112-lucy would like to drop the august title of [the Eternal Woman]675-the eternal woman , and go [there]334-there as [her]112-lucy transitory self .

[Lucy]112-lucy does not stand for [the medieval lady]677-the medieval lady , who was rather an ideal to which [she]112-lucy was bidden to lift [her]112-lucy eyes when feeling serious . Nor has [she]112-lucy any system of revolt . Here and there a restriction annoyed [her]112-lucy particularly , and [she]112-lucy would transgress it , and perhaps be sorry that [she]112-lucy had done so . " And what is the plot ? "[111-miss bartlett]

" [I]128-miss lavish hope [you]111-miss bartlett will excuse [me]128-miss lavish for boring on like this , "[128-miss lavish] [Miss Lavish]128-miss lavish concluded . " Thank [you]333-the girl , [Charlotte]111-miss bartlett , "[112-lucy] said [Lucy]112-lucy , and pondered over the offer .

[She]333-the girl recalled the free , pleasant life of [[her]333-the girl home]836-her home , where [she]333-the girl was allowed to do everything , and where nothing ever happened to [her]333-the girl . " And the news ? "[111-miss bartlett] asked [Miss Bartlett]111-miss bartlett .

" [Mrs. Vyse]175-dear mrs. vyse and [[her]175-dear mrs. vyse son]2429-her son have gone to [Rome]33-rome , "[112-lucy] said [Lucy]112-lucy , giving the news that interested [her]112-lucy least . " Do [you]111-miss bartlett know [the Vyses]176-the vyses ? "[112-lucy]

" [I]111-miss bartlett die for it ! "[111-miss bartlett]

[The Piazza Signoria]685-the piazza signoria is too stony to be brilliant . [It]685-the piazza signoria has no grass , no flowers , no frescoes , no glittering walls of marble or comforting patches of ruddy brick . By an odd chance - unless [we]843-we believe in a presiding genius of places - the statues that relieve its severity suggest , not the innocence of childhood , nor the glorious bewilderment of youth , but the conscious achievements of maturity . [Perseus]177-perseus and [Judith]178-judith , [Hercules]179-hercules and [Thusnelda]180-thusnelda , [they]844-they have done or suffered something , and though [they]844-they are immortal , immortality has come to [them]844-they after experience , not before . Here , not only in the solitude of Nature , might [a hero]845-a hero meet [a goddess]846-a goddess , or [a heroine]847-a heroine [a god]848-a god .

" [Charlotte]111-miss bartlett ! "[333-the girl] cried [the girl]333-the girl suddenly . " Here 's an idea . "[333-the girl]

[Miss Bartlett]111-miss bartlett , with equal vivacity , replied :

" Oh , [[you]111-miss bartlett droll person]2436-you droll person ! Pray , what would become of [your]111-miss bartlett drive in [the hills]613-the hills ? "[111-miss bartlett]

[They]850-they passed together through the gaunt beauty of [the square]2349-the square , laughing over the unpractical suggestion .

Chapter VI : [The Reverend Arthur Beebe]181-the reverend arthur beebe , [the Reverend Cuthbert Eager]182-the reverend cuthbert eager , [Mr. Emerson]115-george , [Mr. George Emerson]115-george , [Miss Eleanor Lavish]128-miss lavish , [Miss Charlotte Bartlett]111-miss bartlett , and [Miss Lucy Honeychurch]112-lucy Drive Out in Carriages to See a View ; [Italians Drive]124-italians [Them]852-them .

It was [Phaethon]183-phaethon who drove [them]850-they to [Fiesole]7-fiesole that memorable day , [a youth all irresponsibility and fire]853-a youth all irresponsibility and fire , recklessly urging [[his]183-phaethon master]854-his master 's horses up [the stony hill]855-the stony hill . [Mr. Beebe]116-mr. beebe recognized [him]183-phaethon at once . [Neither the Ages of Faith nor the Age of Doubt]856-neither the ages of faith nor the age of doubt had touched [him]183-phaethon ; [he]183-phaethon was [Phaethon]183-phaethon in [Tuscany]57-tuscany driving [a cab]857-a cab . And it was [Persephone]184-persephone whom [he]116-mr. beebe asked leave to pick up on the way , saying that [she]184-persephone was [[his]116-mr. beebe sister]858-his sister - [Persephone]184-persephone , tall and slender and pale , returning with the Spring to [[[her]184-persephone mother]442-her mother 's cottage]860-her mother 's cottage , and still shading [her]184-persephone eyes from the unaccustomed light . To [her]184-persephone [Mr. Eager]146-mr. eager objected , saying that here was the thin edge of the wedge , and one must guard against imposition . But [the ladies]300-the ladies interceded , and when it had been made clear that it was a very great favour , [the goddess]862-the goddess was allowed to mount beside [the god]863-the god .

[Phaethon]183-phaethon at once slipped the left rein over [her]184-persephone head , thus enabling [himself]183-phaethon to drive with [his]183-phaethon arm round [her]184-persephone waist . [She]184-persephone did not mind . [Mr. Eager]146-mr. eager , who sat with [his]146-mr. eager back to the horses , saw nothing of the indecorous proceeding , and continued [his]146-mr. eager conversation with [Lucy]112-lucy . [The other two occupants of]864-the other two occupants of [the carriage]865-the carriage were [old Mr. Emerson]115-george and [Miss Lavish]866-miss lavish . For a dreadful thing had happened : [Mr. Beebe]116-mr. beebe , without consulting [Mr. Eager]146-mr. eager , had doubled the size of [the party]867-the party . And though [Miss Bartlett]111-miss bartlett and [Miss Lavish]128-miss lavish had planned all the morning how [the people]868-the people were to sit , at the critical moment when [the carriages]869-the carriages came round [they]868-the people lost [their]868-the people heads , and [Miss Lavish]128-miss lavish got in with [Lucy]112-lucy , while [Miss Bartlett]111-miss bartlett , with [George Emerson]115-george and [Mr. Beebe]116-mr. beebe , followed on behind .

It was hard on [the poor chaplain]870-the poor chaplain to have [his]870-the poor chaplain partie carree thus transformed . Tea at [a Renaissance villa]790-a renaissance villa , if [he]870-the poor chaplain had ever meditated it , was now impossible . [Lucy]112-lucy and [Miss Bartlett]111-miss bartlett had a certain style about [them]872-them , and [Mr. Beebe]116-mr. beebe , though unreliable , was [a man of parts]873-a man of parts . But [a shoddy lady writer and a journalist who had murdered [[his]116-mr. beebe wife]2415-his wife in the sight of [God]148-god]874-a shoddy lady writer and a journalist who had murdered his wife in the sight of god - [they]872-them should enter [no villa]876-no villa at [his]116-mr. beebe introduction .

[Lucy]112-lucy , elegantly dressed in white , sat erect and nervous amid these explosive ingredients , attentive to [Mr. Eager]146-mr. eager , repressive towards [Miss Lavish]128-miss lavish , watchful of [old Mr. Emerson]115-george , hitherto fortunately asleep , thanks to a heavy lunch and the drowsy atmosphere of Spring . [She]112-lucy looked on the expedition as the work of [Fate]185-fate . But for it [she]112-lucy would have avoided [George Emerson]115-george successfully . In an open manner [he]115-george had shown that [he]115-george wished to continue [their]877-their intimacy . [She]112-lucy had refused , not because [she]112-lucy disliked [him]115-george , but because [she]112-lucy did not know what had happened , and suspected that [he]115-george did know . And this frightened [her]112-lucy .

For the real event - whatever it was - had taken place , not in [the Loggia]51-the loggia , but by [the river]405-the river . To behave wildly at the sight of death is pardonable . But to discuss it afterwards , to pass from discussion into silence , and through silence into sympathy , that is an error , not of a startled emotion , but of the whole fabric . There was really something blameworthy [she]112-lucy thought in [their]877-their joint contemplation of [the shadowy stream]879-the shadowy stream , in the common impulse which had turned [them]877-their to [the house]880-the house without the passing of a look or word . This sense of wickedness had been slight at first . [She]112-lucy had nearly joined the party to [the Torre del Gallo]58-the torre del gallo . But each time that [she]112-lucy avoided [George]115-george it became more imperative that [she]112-lucy should avoid [him]115-george again . And now [celestial irony]186-celestial irony , working through [[her]112-lucy cousin]314-her cousin and [two clergymen]882-two clergymen , did not suffer [her]112-lucy to leave [Florence]14-florence till [she]112-lucy had made this expedition with [him]115-george through [the hills]613-the hills .

[Meanwhile Mr. Eager]146-mr. eager held [her]112-lucy in civil converse ; [their]877-their little tiff was over .

[Mr. Eager]146-mr. eager could not resist the opportunity for erudition .

[A hollow like [a great amphitheatre , full of terraced steps and misty olives]926-a great amphitheatre , full of terraced steps and misty olives]925-a hollow like a great amphitheatre , full of terraced steps and misty olives , now lay between [them]920-we and [the heights of [Fiesole]7-fiesole]927-the heights of fiesole , and [the road]404-the road , still following [its]404-the road curve , was about to sweep on to [a promontory which stood out in [the plain]930-the plain]929-a promontory which stood out in the plain . It was [this promontory]931-this promontory , uncultivated , wet , covered with bushes and occasional trees , which had caught the fancy of [Alessio Baldovinetti]168-alessio baldovinetti nearly five hundred years before . But where exactly had [he]146-mr. eager stood ? That was the question which [Mr. Eager]146-mr. eager hoped to solve now . And [Miss Lavish]128-miss lavish , whose nature was attracted by anything problematical , had become equally enthusiastic .

But it is not easy to carry the pictures of [Alessio Baldovinetti]168-alessio baldovinetti in [your]933-your head , even if [you]933-your have remembered to look at them before starting . And the haze in [the valley]934-the valley increased the difficulty of the quest .

[The party]867-the party sprang about from tuft to tuft of grass , [their]867-the party anxiety to keep together being only equalled by [their]867-the party desire to go different directions . Chapter VII : [They]981-them Return

Some complicated game had been playing up and down [the hillside]2382-the hillside all the afternoon . What it was and exactly how [the players]983-the players had sided , [Lucy]112-lucy was slow to discover . [Mr. Eager]146-mr. eager had met [them]981-them with a questioning eye . [Pan]116-mr. beebe had been amongst [them]981-them - not [the great god [Pan]116-mr. beebe , who has been buried these two thousand years , but the little god [Pan]116-mr. beebe , who presides over social contretemps and unsuccessful picnics . That last fact was undeniable . [He]183-phaethon climbed on to the box shivering , with [his]183-phaethon collar up , prophesying the swift approach of bad weather . [Mr. Eager]146-mr. eager addressed [her]112-lucy professionally :

There was an explosion up [the road]404-the road . The storm had struck the overhead wire of the tramline , and one of the great supports had fallen . If [they]1012-they had not stopped perhaps [they]1012-they might have been hurt . [They]1012-they chose to regard it as a miraculous preservation , and the floods of love and sincerity , which fructify every hour of life , burst forth in tumult . [They]1012-they descended from [the carriages]869-the carriages ; [they]1012-they embraced [each other]700-each other . [The older people]1015-the older people recovered quickly . In the very height of [their]1015-the older people emotion [they]1015-the older people knew it to be unmanly or unladylike . " [I]112-lucy trust not . [One]2064-one would always pray against that . "[112-lucy]

[Miss Bartlett]111-miss bartlett was silent . Indeed , [she]111-miss bartlett had little more to learn . All the way back [Lucy]112-lucy 's body was shaken by deep sighs , which nothing could repress .

" [I]112-lucy want to be truthful , "[112-lucy] [she]112-lucy whispered . " It is so hard to be absolutely truthful . "[112-lucy]

" Do n't be troubled , [dearest]2089-dearest . Wait till [you]112-lucy are calmer . [We]1025-we will talk it over before bed - time in [[my]112-lucy room]2290-my room . "[112-lucy]

So [they]1025-we re - entered [the city]458-the city with hands clasped . It was a shock to [the girl]333-the girl to find how far emotion had ebbed in [others]663-others . The storm had ceased , and [Mr. Emerson]115-george was easier about [[his]115-george son]316-his son . [Mr. Beebe]116-mr. beebe had regained good humour , and [Mr. Eager]146-mr. eager was already snubbing [Miss Lavish]128-miss lavish . [Charlotte]111-miss bartlett alone [she]112-lucy was sure of - [Charlotte]111-miss bartlett , whose exterior concealed so much insight and love .

The luxury of self - exposure kept [her]112-lucy almost happy through the long evening . [She]112-lucy thought not so much of what had happened as of how [she]112-lucy should describe it . All [her]112-lucy sensations , [her]112-lucy spasms of courage , [her]112-lucy moments of unreasonable joy , [her]112-lucy mysterious discontent , should be carefully laid before [[her]112-lucy cousin]314-her cousin . And together in divine confidence [they]1031-they would disentangle and interpret [them]1032-them all .

" At last , "[112-lucy] thought [she]112-lucy , " [I]112-lucy shall understand [myself]112-lucy . [I]112-lucy sha n't again be troubled by things that come out of nothing , and mean [I]112-lucy do n't know what . "[112-lucy]

[Miss Alan]144-miss alan asked [her]112-lucy to play . [She]112-lucy refused vehemently . Music seemed to [her]112-lucy the employment of [a child]1033-a child . [She]112-lucy sat close to [[her]112-lucy cousin]314-her cousin , who , with commendable patience , was listening to a long story about lost luggage . When it was over [she]112-lucy capped it by a story of [her]112-lucy own . [Lucy]112-lucy became rather hysterical with the delay . In vain [she]112-lucy tried to check , or at all events to accelerate , the tale . It was not till a late hour that [Miss Bartlett]111-miss bartlett had recovered [her]111-miss bartlett luggage and could say in [her]111-miss bartlett usual tone of gentle reproach :

" Well , [dear]2075-dear , [I]111-miss bartlett at all events am ready for [Bedfordshire]197-bedfordshire . Come into [[my]111-miss bartlett room]2290-my room , and [I]111-miss bartlett will give a good brush to [your]2075-dear hair . "[111-miss bartlett]

With some solemnity the door was shut , and a cane chair placed for [the girl]333-the girl . Then [Miss Bartlett]111-miss bartlett said " So what is to be done ? "[111-miss bartlett]

[She]112-lucy was unprepared for the question . It had not occurred to [her]112-lucy that [she]112-lucy would have to do anything . A detailed exhibition of [her]112-lucy emotions was all that [she]112-lucy had counted upon .

" What is to be done ? A point , dearest , which [you]2075-dear alone can settle . "[111-miss bartlett]

The rain was streaming down the black windows , and [the great room]1036-the great room felt damp and chilly , One candle burnt trembling on the chest of drawers close to [Miss Bartlett]111-miss bartlett 's toque , which cast monstrous and fantastic shadows on the bolted door . [A tram]1037-a tram roared by in the dark , and [Lucy]112-lucy felt unaccountably sad , though [she]112-lucy had long since dried [her]112-lucy eyes . [She]112-lucy lifted them to the ceiling , where the griffins and bassoons were colourless and vague , the very ghosts of joy .

" It has been raining for nearly four hours , "[112-lucy] [she]112-lucy said at last .

[Miss Bartlett]111-miss bartlett ignored the remark .

" How do [you]112-lucy propose to silence [him]2522-him ? "[112-lucy]

" [The driver]2165-the driver ? "[112-lucy]

" [[My]112-lucy dear girl]2524-my dear girl , no ; [Mr. George Emerson]115-george . "[112-lucy]

[Lucy]112-lucy began to pace up and down [the room]325-the room .

" [I]112-lucy do n't understand , "[112-lucy] [she]112-lucy said at last .

[She]112-lucy understood very well , but [she]112-lucy no longer wished to be absolutely truthful .

" How are [you]112-lucy going to stop [him]2522-him talking about it ? "[112-lucy]

" [I]112-lucy have a feeling that talk is a thing [he]2522-him will never do . "[112-lucy]

" [I]112-lucy , too , intend to judge [him]2522-him charitably . But unfortunately [I]112-lucy have met [the type]2525-the type before . [They]2525-the type seldom keep [their]2525-the type exploits to [themselves]2525-the type . "[112-lucy]

" Exploits ? "[112-lucy] cried [Lucy]112-lucy , wincing under the horrible plural .

" [[My]112-lucy poor dear]2526-my poor dear , did [you]112-lucy suppose that this was [his]2522-him first ? Come here and listen to [me]112-lucy . [I]112-lucy am only gathering it from [his]2522-him own remarks . Do [you]112-lucy remember that day at lunch when [he]2522-him argued with [Miss Alan]144-miss alan that liking [one person]2293-one person is an extra reason for liking another ? "[112-lucy]

" Yes , "[112-lucy] said [Lucy]112-lucy , whom at the time the argument had pleased .

" Well , [I]112-lucy am [no prude]2528-no prude . There is no need to call [him]2522-him [a wicked young man ,]2529-a wicked young man , but obviously [he]2522-him is thoroughly unrefined . An idea rushed across [Lucy]112-lucy 's brain , which , had [she]112-lucy thought of it sooner and made it part of [her]112-lucy , might have proved victorious .

[Miss Bartlett]111-miss bartlett uttered a cry of genuine alarm .

" But [we]2531-we fear [him]2522-him for [you]112-lucy , [dear]2075-dear . " [I]112-lucy should have - "[112-lucy] [She]112-lucy checked [herself]112-lucy , and broke the sentence off . [She]112-lucy went up to the dripping window and strained [her]112-lucy eyes into the darkness . [She]112-lucy could not think what [she]112-lucy would have done .

[Lucy]112-lucy obeyed . [She]112-lucy was in [[her]112-lucy cousin]314-her cousin 's power . [She]112-lucy could not modulate out the key of self - abasement in which [she]112-lucy had started . [Neither of [them]1041-them]1040-neither of them referred again to [her]112-lucy suggestion that [she]112-lucy should speak to [George]115-george and settle the matter , whatever it was , with [him]115-george .

" Yes , but [they]1043-they pay extra for wine . "[111-miss bartlett] After this remark [she]111-miss bartlett remained motionless and silent . To [her]111-miss bartlett tired eyes [Charlotte]111-miss bartlett throbbed and swelled like a ghostly figure in a dream .

[They]1043-they began to sort [their]1043-they clothes for packing , for there was no time to lose , if [they]1043-they were to catch [the train]2549-the train to [Rome]33-rome . [Lucy]112-lucy , when admonished , began to move to and fro between [the rooms]2074-the rooms , more conscious of the discomforts of packing by candlelight than of a subtler ill . [Charlotte]111-miss bartlett , who was practical without ability , knelt by the side of an empty trunk , vainly endeavouring to pave it with books of varying thickness and size . [She]111-miss bartlett gave two or three sighs , for the stooping posture hurt [her]111-miss bartlett back , and , for all [her]111-miss bartlett diplomacy , [she]111-miss bartlett felt that [she]111-miss bartlett was growing old . [The girl]333-the girl heard [her]111-miss bartlett as [she]111-miss bartlett entered [the room]325-the room , and was seized with one of those emotional impulses to which [she]111-miss bartlett could never attribute a cause . [She]111-miss bartlett only felt that the candle would burn better , the packing go easier , [the world]2079-the world be happier , if [she]111-miss bartlett could give and receive some human love . The impulse had come before to - day , but never so strongly . [She]111-miss bartlett knelt down by [[her]111-miss bartlett cousin]314-her cousin 's side and took [her]314-her cousin in [her]111-miss bartlett arms .

[Miss Bartlett]111-miss bartlett returned the embrace with tenderness and warmth . But [she]111-miss bartlett was not [a stupid woman]1050-a stupid woman , and [she]111-miss bartlett knew perfectly well that [Lucy]112-lucy did not love [her]111-miss bartlett , but needed [her]111-miss bartlett to love . For it was in ominous tones that [she]111-miss bartlett said , after a long pause :

" Dearest [Lucy]112-lucy , how will [you]112-lucy ever forgive [me]111-miss bartlett ? "[111-miss bartlett]

[Lucy]112-lucy was on [her]112-lucy guard at once , knowing by bitter experience what forgiving [Miss Bartlett]111-miss bartlett meant . [Her]112-lucy emotion relaxed , [she]112-lucy modified [her]112-lucy embrace a little , and [she]112-lucy said :

" [Charlotte]111-miss bartlett dear , what do [you]111-miss bartlett mean ? As if [I]112-lucy have anything to forgive ! "[112-lucy]

" [You]111-miss bartlett have a great deal , and [I]112-lucy have a very great deal to forgive [myself]112-lucy , too . [I]112-lucy know well how much [I]112-lucy vex [you]111-miss bartlett at every turn . "[112-lucy]

" But no - "[112-lucy]

[Miss Bartlett]111-miss bartlett assumed [her]111-miss bartlett favourite role , that of [the prematurely aged martyr]1051-the prematurely aged martyr .

" Ah , but yes ! [I]112-lucy feel that [our]2551-our tour together is hardly the success [I]112-lucy had hoped . [I]112-lucy might have known it would not do . " Please - "[112-lucy]

[I]112-lucy had [my]112-lucy own poor ideas of what [a lady]664-a lady ought to do , but [I]112-lucy hope [I]112-lucy did not inflict them on [you]111-miss bartlett more than was necessary . " [You]111-miss bartlett must n't say these things , "[112-lucy] said [Lucy]112-lucy softly .

[She]112-lucy still clung to the hope that [she]112-lucy and [Charlotte]111-miss bartlett loved [each other]700-each other , heart and soul . [They]1053-they continued to pack in silence .

" [I]111-miss bartlett have been [a failure]2557-a failure , "[111-miss bartlett] said [Miss Bartlett]111-miss bartlett , as [she]111-miss bartlett struggled with the straps of [Lucy]112-lucy 's trunk instead of strapping [her]111-miss bartlett own . " Every right . "[111-miss bartlett]

" But [you]111-miss bartlett tell [her]2068-your mother everything ? "[111-miss bartlett]

" [I]112-lucy suppose [I]112-lucy do generally . "[112-lucy]

[The girl]333-the girl would not be degraded to this .

" Naturally [I]112-lucy should have told [her]2068-your mother . But in case [she]2068-your mother should blame [you]112-lucy in any way , [I]112-lucy promise [I]112-lucy will not , [I]112-lucy am very willing not to . [I]112-lucy will never speak of it either to [her]2068-your mother or to [any one]349-any one . "[112-lucy]

[Her]333-the girl promise brought the long - drawn interview to a sudden close . [Miss Bartlett]111-miss bartlett pecked [her]333-the girl smartly on both cheeks , wished [her]333-the girl good - night , and sent [her]333-the girl to [[her]333-the girl own room]393-her own room .

For a moment the original trouble was in the background . [George]115-george would seem to have behaved like [a cad throughout]1056-a cad throughout ; perhaps that was the view which [one]2064-one would take eventually . At present [she]333-the girl neither acquitted nor condemned [him]115-george ; [she]333-the girl did not pass judgment . At the moment when [she]333-the girl was about to judge [him]115-george [[her]333-the girl cousin]314-her cousin 's voice had intervened , and , ever since , it was [Miss Bartlett]111-miss bartlett who had dominated ; [Miss Bartlett]111-miss bartlett [who , even now , could be heard sighing into a crack in the partition wall]1059-who , even now , could be heard sighing into a crack in the partition wall ; [Miss Bartlett]111-miss bartlett , who had really been neither pliable nor humble nor inconsistent . [She]333-the girl had worked like [a great artist]807-a great artist ; for a time - indeed , for years - [she]333-the girl had been meaningless , but at the end there was presented to [the girl]333-the girl the complete picture of a cheerless , loveless world in which [the young]1062-the young rush to destruction until [they]1062-the young learn better - a shamefaced world of precautions and barriers which may avert evil , but which do not seem to bring good , if [we]1063-we may judge from [those who have used them most]1064-those who have used them most .

[Lucy]112-lucy was suffering from the most grievous wrong which [this world]569-this world has yet discovered : diplomatic advantage had been taken of [her]112-lucy sincerity , of [her]112-lucy craving for sympathy and love . Such a wrong is not easily forgotten . Never again did [she]112-lucy expose [herself]112-lucy without due consideration and precaution against rebuff . And such a wrong may react disastrously upon the soul .

The door - bell rang , and [she]112-lucy started to the shutters . Before [she]112-lucy reached them [she]112-lucy hesitated , turned , and blew out the candle . Thus it was that , though [she]112-lucy saw [some one standing in the wet below]1066-some one standing in the wet below , [he]1066-some one standing in the wet below , though [he]1066-some one standing in the wet below looked up , did not see [her]112-lucy .

To reach [[his]1066-some one standing in the wet below room]1067-his room [he]1066-some one standing in the wet below had to go by [hers]112-lucy . [She]112-lucy was still dressed . It struck [her]112-lucy that [she]112-lucy might slip into [the passage]1068-the passage and just say that [she]112-lucy would be gone before [he]1066-some one standing in the wet below was up , and that [their]1069-their extraordinary intercourse was over .

Whether [she]112-lucy would have dared to do this was never proved . At the critical moment [Miss Bartlett]111-miss bartlett opened [her]111-miss bartlett own door , and [her]111-miss bartlett voice said :

" [I]111-miss bartlett wish one word with [you]1066-some one standing in the wet below in [the drawing - room]358-the drawing - room , [Mr. Emerson]115-george , please . "[111-miss bartlett]

Soon [their]1069-their footsteps returned , and [Miss Bartlett]111-miss bartlett said : " Good - night , [Mr. Emerson]115-george . "[111-miss bartlett]

[His]1066-some one standing in the wet below heavy , tired breathing was the only reply ; [the chaperon]1070-the chaperon had done [her]1070-the chaperon work .

[Lucy]112-lucy cried aloud : " It is n't true . It ca n't all be true . [I]112-lucy want not to be muddled . [I]112-lucy want to grow older quickly . "[112-lucy]

[Miss Bartlett]111-miss bartlett tapped on the wall .

" Go to bed at once , [dear]2075-dear . [You]2075-dear need all the rest [you]2075-dear can get . "[111-miss bartlett]

In the morning [they]1069-their left for [Rome]33-rome .

Part Two

Chapter VIII : Medieval

The drawing - room curtains at [Windy Corner]6-windy corner had been pulled to meet , for the carpet was new and deserved protection from the August sun . They were heavy curtains , reaching almost to the ground , and the light that filtered through them was subdued and varied . [A poet]1071-a poet - [none was present]1072-none was present - might have quoted , " Life like a dome of many coloured glass , "[1071-a poet] or might have compared the curtains to sluice - gates , lowered against the intolerable tides of heaven . Without was poured a sea of radiance ; within , the glory , though visible , was tempered to the capacities of [man]2244-man .

[Two pleasant people]1074-two pleasant people sat in [the room]325-the room . [One]2064-one - [a boy of nineteen]1077-a boy of nineteen - was studying a small manual of anatomy , and peering occasionally at a bone which lay upon the piano . From time to time [he]2064-one bounced in [his]2064-one chair and puffed and groaned , for the day was hot and the print small , and the human frame fearfully made ; and [[his]2064-one mother]1078-his mother , who was writing a letter , did continually read out to [him]2064-one what [she]1078-his mother had written . And continually did [she]1078-his mother rise from [her]1078-his mother seat and part the curtains so that a rivulet of light fell across the carpet , and make the remark that they were still there .

" Where are n't [they]1074-two pleasant people ? "[727-the boy] said [the boy]727-the boy , who was [Freddy]121-freddy , [[Lucy]112-lucy 's brother]1080-lucy 's brother . " [I]727-the boy tell [you]152-mrs. honeychurch [I]727-the boy 'm getting fairly sick . "[727-the boy]

" For goodness ' sake go out of [[my]152-mrs. honeychurch drawing - room]2567-my drawing - room , then ? "[152-mrs. honeychurch] cried [Mrs. Honeychurch]152-mrs. honeychurch , who hoped to cure [[her]152-mrs. honeychurch children]1081-her children of slang by taking it literally .

[Freddy]121-freddy did not move or reply .

" [I]152-mrs. honeychurch think things are coming to a head , "[152-mrs. honeychurch] [she]152-mrs. honeychurch observed , rather wanting [[her]152-mrs. honeychurch son]2429-her son 's opinion on the situation if [she]152-mrs. honeychurch could obtain it without undue supplication .

" Time [they]1074-two pleasant people did . "[152-mrs. honeychurch]

" [I]152-mrs. honeychurch am glad that [Cecil]198-cecil is asking [her]152-mrs. honeychurch this once more . "[152-mrs. honeychurch]

" [It]2568-it 's [his]198-cecil third go , is n't it ? "[152-mrs. honeychurch]

" [Freddy]121-freddy [I]152-mrs. honeychurch do call the way [you]121-freddy talk unkind . "[152-mrs. honeychurch]

" [I]121-freddy did n't mean to be unkind . "[121-freddy] Then [he]121-freddy added : " But [I]121-freddy do think [Lucy]112-lucy might have got this off [her]112-lucy chest in [Italy]11-italy . [I]121-freddy do n't know how [girls]624-girls manage things , but [she]112-lucy ca n't have said ' No ' properly before , or [she]112-lucy would n't have to say it again now . Over the whole thing - [I]121-freddy ca n't explain - [I]121-freddy do feel so uncomfortable . "[121-freddy]

" Do [you]121-freddy indeed , [dear]2075-dear ? How interesting ! "[152-mrs. honeychurch]

" [I]121-freddy feel - never mind . "[121-freddy]

[He]121-freddy returned to [his]121-freddy work .

" Just listen to what [I]152-mrs. honeychurch have written to [Mrs. Vyse]175-dear mrs. vyse . [I]152-mrs. honeychurch said : ' [Dear Mrs. Vyse]175-dear mrs. vyse . ' "[152-mrs. honeychurch]

" Yes , [mother]2081-mother , [you]121-freddy told [me]152-mrs. honeychurch . A jolly good letter . "[152-mrs. honeychurch]

[Cecil]198-cecil entered .

Appearing thus late in the story , [Cecil]198-cecil must be at once described . [He]198-cecil was medieval . Like a Gothic statue . Tall and refined , with shoulders that seemed braced square by an effort of the will , and a head that was tilted a little higher than the usual level of vision , [he]198-cecil resembled [those fastidious saints who guard the portals of [a French cathedral]1102-a french cathedral]1101-those fastidious saints who guard the portals of a french cathedral . A Gothic statue implies celibacy , just as a Greek statue implies fruition , and perhaps this was what [Mr. Beebe]116-mr. beebe meant . And [Freddy]121-freddy , who ignored history and art , perhaps meant the same when [he]121-freddy failed to imagine [Cecil]198-cecil wearing [another fellow]1094-another fellow 's cap .

Smiling indulgently , [he]198-cecil lit a cigarette , and rehearsed the events that had led to such a happy conclusion .

[He]198-cecil had known [Lucy]112-lucy for several years , but only as [a commonplace girl who happened to be musical]1119-a commonplace girl who happened to be musical . [He]198-cecil could still remember [his]198-cecil depression that afternoon at [Rome]33-rome , when [she]112-lucy and [[her]112-lucy terrible cousin]1120-her terrible cousin fell on [him]198-cecil out of the blue , and demanded to be taken to [St. Peter 's]4-st. peter . " [She]112-lucy did develop most wonderfully day by day .[1124-no woman of leonardo 's]

So it happened that from patronizing civility [he]198-cecil had slowly passed if not to passion , at least to a profound uneasiness . Already at [Rome]33-rome [he]198-cecil had hinted to [her]112-lucy that [they]1125-they might be suitable for [each other]700-each other . It had touched [him]198-cecil greatly that [she]112-lucy had not broken away at the suggestion . [Her]112-lucy refusal had been clear and gentle ; after it - as the horrid phrase went - [she]112-lucy had been exactly the same to [him]198-cecil as before . Three months later , on [the margin of [Italy]11-italy]1127-the margin of italy , among [the flower - clad Alps]1128-the flower - clad alps , [he]198-cecil had asked [her]112-lucy again in bald , traditional language . [She]112-lucy reminded [him]198-cecil of [a Leonardo]1129-a leonardo more than ever ; [her]112-lucy sunburnt features were shadowed by fantastic rock ; at [his]198-cecil words [she]112-lucy had turned and stood between [him]198-cecil and the light with immeasurable plains behind [her]112-lucy . [He]198-cecil walked [home]376-home with [her]112-lucy unashamed , feeling not at all like [a rejected suitor]1131-a rejected suitor . The things that really mattered were unshaken .

So now [he]198-cecil had asked [her]112-lucy once more , and , clear and gentle as ever , [she]112-lucy had accepted [him]198-cecil , giving no coy reasons for [her]112-lucy delay , but simply saying that [she]112-lucy loved [him]198-cecil and would do [her]112-lucy best to make [him]198-cecil happy . [[His]198-cecil mother]1078-his mother , too , would be pleased ; [she]1078-his mother had counselled the step ; [he]198-cecil must write [her]1078-his mother a long account .

[He]198-cecil recoiled without reading any more , and after a little hesitation sat down elsewhere , and pencilled a note on [his]198-cecil knee .

Then [he]198-cecil lit another cigarette , which did not seem quite as divine as the first , and considered what might be done to make [Windy Corner drawing - room]1133-windy corner drawing - room more distinctive . With that outlook it should have been [a successful room]1134-a successful room , but [the trail of [Tottenham Court Road]67-tottenham court road]1135-the trail of tottenham court road was upon [it]1134-a successful room ; [he]198-cecil could almost visualize the motor - vans of [Messrs. The table recalled [Mrs. Honeychurch]152-mrs. honeychurch 's letter . [He]198-cecil did not want to read that letter - [his]198-cecil temptations never lay in that direction ; but [he]198-cecil worried about it none the less . " [Mr. Beebe]116-mr. beebe ! " [I]198-cecil should say so . Food is the thing one does get [here]2059-here - Do n't sit in that chair ; [young Honeychurch]112-lucy has left a bone in it . "[198-cecil]

Immediately [he]1158-he realized that of all the conceited , ludicrous , contemptible ways of announcing an engagement this was the worst . [Cecil]198-cecil , who naturally preferred congratulations to apologies , drew down [his]198-cecil mouth at the corners . Occasionally [he]198-cecil could be quite crude .

" [Grazie tante]2631-grazie tante ! "[198-cecil] said [Cecil]198-cecil , who did not like parsons .

[Freddy]121-freddy , now full of geniality , whistled the wedding march . [Youth]214-youth seldom criticizes the accomplished fact .

" Indeed [I]121-freddy have ! "[121-freddy] [he]121-freddy cried . [He]121-freddy looked at [Lucy]112-lucy . " [Mrs. Honeychurch]152-mrs. honeychurch , [I]121-freddy 'm going to do what [I]121-freddy am always supposed to do , but generally [I]121-freddy 'm too shy . " [You]1168-the parson only asked for it just in time , "[1169-the lady] [the lady]1169-the lady retorted . " How dare [you]1168-the parson be serious at [Windy Corner]6-windy corner ? "[1169-the lady]

[He]1168-the parson took [his]1168-the parson tone from [her]1169-the lady . There was no more heavy beneficence , no more attempts to dignify the situation with poetry or the Scriptures . [None of [them]1171-they]1170-none of them dared or was able to be serious any more .

An engagement is so potent a thing that sooner or later it reduces [all who speak of it to this state of cheerful awe]1172-all who speak of it to this state of cheerful awe . Away from it , in the solitude of [[their]1171-they rooms]2138-their rooms , [Mr. Beebe]116-mr. beebe , and even [Freddy]121-freddy , might again be critical . But in its presence and in the presence of [each other]700-each other [they]1171-they were sincerely hilarious . It has a strange power , for it compels not only the lips , but the very heart . The chief parallel to compare one great thing with another - is the power over [us]1175-we of [a temple of some alien creed]1176-a temple of some alien creed . Standing outside , [we]1175-we deride or oppose it , or at the most feel sentimental . Inside , though [the saints and gods]1177-the saints and gods are not [ours]1175-we , [we]1175-we become [true believers]1178-true believers , in case [any true believer]1179-any true believer should be present .

So it was that after the gropings and the misgivings of the afternoon [they]1171-they pulled [themselves]1171-they together and settled down to a very pleasant tea - party . If [they]1171-they were [hypocrites]1180-hypocrites [they]1171-they did not know it , and [their]1171-they hypocrisy had every chance of setting and of becoming true . [Anne]210-anne , putting down each plate as if it were a wedding present , stimulated [them]1171-they greatly . [They]1171-they could not lag behind that smile of [hers]210-anne which [she]210-anne gave [them]1171-they ere [she]210-anne kicked the drawing - room door . [Mr. Beebe]116-mr. beebe chirruped . [Freddy]121-freddy was at [his]121-freddy wittiest , referring to [Cecil]198-cecil as the " Fiasco "[121-freddy] - family honoured pun on [fiance]1181-fiance . [Mrs. Honeychurch]152-mrs. honeychurch , amusing and portly , promised well as [a mother - in - law]1182-a mother - in - law . As for [Lucy]112-lucy and [Cecil]198-cecil , for whom [the temple]1183-the temple had been built , [they]1171-they also joined in the merry ritual , but waited , as [earnest worshippers]1184-earnest worshippers should , for the disclosure of some holier shrine of joy .

Chapter IX : [Lucy]112-lucy As a Work of Art

A few days after the engagement was announced [Mrs. Honeychurch]152-mrs. honeychurch made [Lucy]112-lucy and [her]152-mrs. honeychurch Fiasco come to a little garden - party in [the neighbourhood]2371-the neighbourhood , for naturally [she]152-mrs. honeychurch wanted to show [people]305-people that [[her]152-mrs. honeychurch daughter]356-her daughter was marrying [a presentable man]1188-a presentable man .

[Cecil]198-cecil was more than presentable ; [he]198-cecil looked distinguished , and it was very pleasant to see [his]198-cecil slim figure keeping step with [Lucy]112-lucy , and [his]198-cecil long , fair face responding when [Lucy]112-lucy spoke to [him]198-cecil . [People]305-people congratulated [Mrs. Honeychurch]152-mrs. honeychurch , which is , [I]0-i believe , a social blunder , but it pleased [her]152-mrs. honeychurch , and [she]152-mrs. honeychurch introduced [Cecil]198-cecil rather indiscriminately to [some stuffy dowagers]1190-some stuffy dowagers .

At tea a misfortune took place : a cup of coffee was upset over [Lucy]112-lucy 's figured silk , and though [Lucy]112-lucy feigned indifference , [[her]112-lucy mother]442-her mother feigned nothing of the sort but dragged [her]112-lucy indoors to have the frock treated by [a sympathetic maid]1192-a sympathetic maid . [They]1193-they were gone some time , and [Cecil]198-cecil was left with [the dowagers]1194-the dowagers . When [they]1193-they returned [he]198-cecil was not as pleasant as [he]198-cecil had been .

" Do [you]112-lucy go to much of this sort of thing ? "[198-cecil] [he]198-cecil asked when [they]1193-they were driving [home]376-home .

" Oh , now and then , "[112-lucy] said [Lucy]112-lucy , who had rather enjoyed [herself]112-lucy .

" Is it typical of country society ? "[198-cecil]

" [I]152-mrs. honeychurch suppose so . [Mother]123-mother , would it be ? "[152-mrs. honeychurch]

" Plenty of society , "[152-mrs. honeychurch] said [Mrs. Honeychurch]152-mrs. honeychurch , who was trying to remember the hang of one of the dresses .

Seeing that [her]152-mrs. honeychurch thoughts were elsewhere , [Cecil]198-cecil bent towards [Lucy]112-lucy and said :

" To [me]198-cecil it seemed perfectly appalling , disastrous , portentous . "[198-cecil]

" [I]152-mrs. honeychurch am so sorry that [you]198-cecil were stranded . "[152-mrs. honeychurch]

" Not that , but the congratulations . It is so disgusting , the way an engagement is regarded as public property - [a kind of waste place where [every outsider]2638-every outsider may shoot [his]2638-every outsider vulgar sentiment]2637-a kind of waste place where every outsider may shoot his vulgar sentiment . [All those old women]2639-all those old women smirking ! "[198-cecil]

" [One]2064-one has to go through it , [I]152-mrs. honeychurch suppose . [They]2639-all those old women wo n't notice [us]2641-us so much next time . "[152-mrs. honeychurch]

" But [my]198-cecil point is that [their]2639-all those old women whole attitude is wrong . An engagement - horrid word in the first place - is a private matter , and should be treated as such . "[198-cecil]

Yet [the smirking old women]1196-the smirking old women , however wrong individually , were racially correct . The spirit of [the generations]1197-the generations had smiled through [them]1196-the smirking old women , rejoicing in the engagement of [Cecil]198-cecil and [Lucy]112-lucy because it promised the continuance of life on [earth]715-earth . To [Cecil]198-cecil and [Lucy]112-lucy it promised something quite different - personal love . Hence [Cecil]198-cecil 's irritation and [Lucy]112-lucy 's belief that [his]198-cecil irritation was just .

" How tiresome ! "[112-lucy] [she]112-lucy said . " Could n't [you]198-cecil have escaped to tennis ? "[112-lucy]

" [I]112-lucy do n't play tennis - at least , not in public . [The neighbourhood]2371-the neighbourhood is deprived of the romance of [me]112-lucy being athletic . Such romance as [I]112-lucy have is that of [the Inglese Italianato]215-the inglese italianato . "[112-lucy]

" Inglese Italianato ? "[112-lucy]

" E un diavolo incarnato ! [You]198-cecil know the proverb ? "[112-lucy]

[She]112-lucy did not . Nor did it seem applicable to [a young man who had spent a quiet winter in [Rome]33-rome with [[his]1199-a young man who had spent a quiet winter in rome with his mother mother]1078-his mother]1199-a young man who had spent a quiet winter in rome with his mother . But [Cecil]198-cecil , since [his]198-cecil engagement , had taken to affect a cosmopolitan naughtiness which [he]198-cecil was far from possessing .

" Well , "[198-cecil] said [he]198-cecil , " [I]198-cecil can not help it if [they]2643-they do disapprove of [me]198-cecil . There are certain irremovable barriers between [myself]198-cecil and [them]2643-they , and [I]198-cecil must accept them . "[198-cecil]

" [We]2644-we all have [our]2644-we limitations , [I]112-lucy suppose , "[112-lucy] said [wise Lucy]112-lucy .

" Sometimes [they]2643-they are forced on [us]2644-we , though , "[198-cecil] said [Cecil]198-cecil , who saw from [her]112-lucy remark that [she]112-lucy did not quite understand [his]198-cecil position .

" How ? "[198-cecil]

" It makes a difference does n't it , whether [we]2644-we fully fence [ourselves]2644-we in , or whether [we]2644-we are fenced out by the barriers of [others]663-others ? "[112-lucy]

[She]112-lucy thought a moment , and agreed that it did make a difference .

" Difference ? "[152-mrs. honeychurch] cried [Mrs. Honeychurch]152-mrs. honeychurch , suddenly alert . " [I]152-mrs. honeychurch do n't see any difference . Fences are fences , especially when they are in the same place . "[152-mrs. honeychurch]

" [We]2644-we were speaking of motives , "[198-cecil] said [Cecil]198-cecil , on whom the interruption jarred .

" [[My]112-lucy dear]2116-my dear [Cecil]198-cecil , look here . "[112-lucy] [She]112-lucy spread out [her]112-lucy knees and perched [her]112-lucy card - case on [her]112-lucy lap . " This is [me]112-lucy . That 's [Windy Corner]6-windy corner . The rest of the pattern is [the other people]2647-the other people . Motives are all very well , but the fence comes here . "[112-lucy]

" [We]2644-we were n't talking of real fences , "[112-lucy] said [Lucy]112-lucy , laughing .

" Oh , [I]112-lucy see , dear - poetry . "[112-lucy]

[She]112-lucy leant placidly back . [Cecil]198-cecil wondered why [Lucy]112-lucy had been amused .

" [I]112-lucy tell [you]198-cecil who has no ' fences , ' as [you]198-cecil call [them]2648-them , "[112-lucy] [she]112-lucy said , " and that 's [Mr. Beebe]116-mr. beebe . "[112-lucy]

" [A parson fenceless]2649-a parson fenceless would mean [a parson defenceless]2650-a parson defenceless . "[112-lucy]

[Lucy]112-lucy was slow to follow what [people]305-people said , but quick enough to detect what [they]305-people meant . [She]112-lucy missed [Cecil]198-cecil 's epigram , but grasped the feeling that prompted it .

" Do n't [you]198-cecil like [Mr. Beebe]116-mr. beebe ? "[112-lucy] [she]112-lucy asked thoughtfully .
