If [Cecil]198-cecil disliked [Sir Harry Otway]133-sir harry and [Mr. Beebe]116-mr. beebe , what guarantee was there that [the people who really mattered to [her]112-lucy]1258-the people who really mattered to her would escape ? For instance , [Freddy]121-freddy . [Freddy]121-freddy was neither clever , nor subtle , nor beautiful , and what prevented [Cecil]198-cecil from saying , any minute , " It would be wrong not to loathe [Freddy]121-freddy "[198-cecil] ? And what would [she]112-lucy reply ? Further than [Freddy]121-freddy [she]112-lucy did not go , but [he]198-cecil gave [her]112-lucy anxiety enough . [She]112-lucy could only assure [herself]112-lucy that [Cecil]198-cecil had known [Freddy]121-freddy some time , and that [they]1259-we had always got on pleasantly , except , perhaps , during the last few days , which was an accident , perhaps .

" Which way shall [we]1259-we go ? "[112-lucy] [she]112-lucy asked [him]198-cecil .

Nature - simplest of topics , [she]112-lucy thought - was around [them]1259-we . [Summer Street]5-summer street lay deep in [the woods]1211-the woods , and [she]112-lucy had stopped where [a footpath]1261-a footpath diverged from [the highroad]1262-the highroad .

" Are there two ways ? "[112-lucy]

" Perhaps [the road]404-the road is more sensible , as [we]1259-we 're got up smart . "[112-lucy]

" [I]198-cecil 'd rather go through the wood , "[198-cecil] said [Cecil]198-cecil , With that subdued irritation that [she]112-lucy had noticed in [him]198-cecil all the afternoon . " Have n't [I]112-lucy ? [The wood]2751-the wood , then , "[112-lucy] said [Lucy]112-lucy , startled at [his]198-cecil queerness , but pretty sure that [he]198-cecil would explain later ; it was not [his]198-cecil habit to leave [her]112-lucy in doubt as to [his]198-cecil meaning .

[She]112-lucy led the way into [the whispering pines]1263-the whispering pines , and sure enough [he]198-cecil did explain before [they]1264-they had gone a dozen yards .

" [I]112-lucy had got an idea - [I]112-lucy dare say wrongly - that [you]112-lucy feel more at home with [me]112-lucy in [a room]2754-a room . "[112-lucy]

" [A room]2754-a room ? "[112-lucy] [she]112-lucy echoed , hopelessly bewildered .

" Yes . Or , at the most , in [a garden]2756-a garden , or on [a road]2757-a road . Never in [the real country]2758-the real country like this . "[112-lucy]

" Oh , [Cecil]198-cecil , whatever do [you]198-cecil mean ? [I]112-lucy have never felt anything of the sort . [You]198-cecil talk as if [I]112-lucy was [a kind of poetess sort of person]2759-a kind of poetess sort of person . "[112-lucy]

" [I]112-lucy do n't know that [you]198-cecil are n't . [I]112-lucy connect [you]198-cecil with a view - a certain type of view . Why should n't [you]198-cecil connect [me]112-lucy with [a room]2754-a room ? "[112-lucy]

[She]112-lucy reflected a moment , and then said , laughing :

" [I]1265-he 'd rather , "[1265-he] [he]1265-he said reproachfully , " that connected [me]1265-he with the open air . "[1265-he]

As no explanation was forthcoming , [she]112-lucy shook off the subject as too difficult for [a girl]514-a girl , and led [him]1265-he further into [the wood]2751-the wood , pausing every now and then at some particularly beautiful or familiar combination of the trees . [She]112-lucy had known [the wood between [Summer Street]5-summer street and [Windy Corner]6-windy corner]1268-the wood between summer street and windy corner ever since [she]112-lucy could walk alone ; [she]112-lucy had played at losing [Freddy]121-freddy in [it]2751-the wood , when [Freddy]121-freddy was [a purple - faced baby]1269-a purple - faced baby ; and though [she]112-lucy had been to [Italy]11-italy , it had lost none of its charm .

Presently [they]1270-they came to [a little clearing among the pines]1271-a little clearing among the pines - [another tiny green alp , solitary this time , and holding in its bosom a shallow pool]1272-another tiny green alp , solitary this time , and holding in its bosom a shallow pool .

[She]112-lucy exclamed , " [The Sacred Lake]71-the sacred lake ! "[112-lucy]

" Why do [you]121-freddy call it that ? "[112-lucy]

" [I]112-lucy ca n't remember why . [I]112-lucy suppose it comes out of some book . It 's only a puddle now , but [you]121-freddy see that stream going through it ? Well , a good deal of water comes down after heavy rains , and ca n't get away at once , and [the pool]2764-the pool becomes quite large and beautiful . Then [Freddy]121-freddy used to bathe [there]334-there . [He]121-freddy is very fond of it . "[112-lucy]

" And [you]112-lucy ? "[121-freddy]

[He]121-freddy meant , " Are [you]112-lucy fond of it ? "[121-freddy] But [she]112-lucy answered dreamily , " [I]112-lucy bathed [here]2059-here , too , till [I]112-lucy was found out . Then there was a row . "[112-lucy]

At another time [he]121-freddy might have been shocked , for [he]121-freddy had depths of prudishness within [him]121-freddy . [He]121-freddy looked at [her]112-lucy as [she]112-lucy stood by [the pool]2764-the pool 's edge . [She]112-lucy was got up smart , as [she]112-lucy phrased it , and [she]112-lucy reminded [him]121-freddy of some brilliant flower that has no leaves of its own , but blooms abruptly out of a world of green .

" Who found [you]112-lucy out ? "[112-lucy]

" [Poor girl]2268-poor girl ! "[112-lucy]

" [Lucy]112-lucy ! "[112-lucy]

" [Lucy]112-lucy , [I]112-lucy want to ask something of [you]112-lucy that [I]112-lucy have never asked before . "[112-lucy]

At the serious note in [his]121-freddy voice [she]112-lucy stepped frankly and kindly towards [him]121-freddy .

[He]121-freddy became self - conscious and kept glancing round to see if [they]1274-they were observed . [His]121-freddy courage had gone .

" Yes ? "[112-lucy]

[She]112-lucy was as scarlet as if [he]121-freddy had put the thing most indelicately .

" Then [I]112-lucy ask [you]121-freddy - may [I]112-lucy now ? "[112-lucy]

" Of course , [you]121-freddy may , [Cecil]198-cecil . [You]121-freddy might before . [I]112-lucy ca n't run at [you]121-freddy , [you]121-freddy know . "[112-lucy]

At that supreme moment [he]121-freddy was conscious of nothing but absurdities . [Her]112-lucy reply was inadequate . [She]112-lucy gave such a business - like lift to [her]112-lucy veil . As [he]121-freddy approached [her]112-lucy [he]121-freddy found time to wish that [he]121-freddy could recoil . As [he]121-freddy touched [her]112-lucy , [his]121-freddy gold pince - nez became dislodged and was flattened between [them]1275-they .

Such was the embrace . [He]121-freddy considered , with truth , that it had been a failure . Passion should believe itself irresistible . It should forget civility and consideration and all the other curses of a refined nature . Above all , it should never ask for leave where there is a right of way . Why could [he]121-freddy not do as [any labourer]1276-any labourer or navvy - nay , as [any young man behind the counter]1277-any young man behind the counter would have done ? [He]121-freddy recast the scene . [Lucy]112-lucy was standing flowerlike by [the water]1278-the water , [he]121-freddy rushed up and took [her]112-lucy in [his]121-freddy arms ; [she]112-lucy rebuked [him]121-freddy , permitted [him]121-freddy and revered [him]121-freddy ever after for [his]121-freddy manliness . For [he]121-freddy believed that [women]2072-women revere [men]2073-men for [their]2073-men manliness .

[They]1275-they left the pool in silence , after this one salutation . [He]121-freddy waited for [her]112-lucy to make some remark which should show [him]121-freddy [her]112-lucy inmost thoughts . At last [she]112-lucy spoke , and with fitting gravity .

" [Emerson]115-george was the name , not [Harris]133-sir harry . "[112-lucy]

" What name ? "[112-lucy]

" [The old man]310-the old man 's . "[112-lucy]

[He]121-freddy could not know that this was the most intimate conversation [they]1275-they had ever had .

Chapter X : [Cecil]198-cecil as [a Humourist

The society out of which [Cecil]198-cecil proposed to rescue [Lucy]112-lucy]1281-a humourist the society out of which cecil proposed to rescue lucy was perhaps no very splendid affair , yet it was more splendid than [her]112-lucy antecedents entitled [her]112-lucy to . [[Her]112-lucy father]1282-her father , [a prosperous local solicitor]1283-a prosperous local solicitor , had built [Windy Corner]6-windy corner , as a speculation at the time [the district]1284-the district was opening up , and , falling in love with [his]1282-her father own creation , had ended by living [there]334-there [himself]1282-her father . Soon after [his]1282-her father marriage the social atmosphere began to alter . [Other houses]1286-other houses were built on the brow of [that steep southern slope]1287-that steep southern slope and others , again , among the pine - trees behind , and northward on [the chalk barrier of [the downs]1289-the downs]1288-the chalk barrier of the downs . [Most of [these houses]1291-these houses]1290-most of these houses were larger than [Windy Corner]6-windy corner , and were filled by [people who came , not from [the district]1284-the district , but from [London]1-london , and who mistook [the Honeychurches]205-the honeychurches]1292-people who came , not from the district , but from london , and who mistook the honeychurches for [the remnants of [an indigenous aristocracy]1295-an indigenous aristocracy]1294-the remnants of an indigenous aristocracy . [He]1282-her father was inclined to be frightened , but [[his]1282-her father wife]2415-his wife accepted the situation without either pride or humility . " [I]2415-his wife can not think what [people]305-people are doing , "[2415-his wife] [she]2415-his wife would say , " but it is extremely fortunate for [the children]2298-the children . "[2415-his wife] [She]2415-his wife called everywhere ; [her]2415-his wife calls were returned with enthusiasm , and by the time [people]305-people found out that [she]2415-his wife was not exactly of [their]305-people milieu , [they]305-people liked [her]2415-his wife , and it did not seem to matter . When [Mr. Honeychurch]222-mr. honeychurch died , [he]1282-her father had the satisfaction - which [few honest solicitors]1298-few honest solicitors despise - of leaving [[his]1282-her father family]1299-his family rooted in the best society obtainable .

The best obtainable . Certainly [many of [the immigrants]1301-the immigrants]1300-many of the immigrants were rather dull , and [Lucy]112-lucy realized this more vividly since [her]112-lucy return from [Italy]11-italy . Hitherto [she]112-lucy had accepted [their]305-people ideals without questioning - [their]305-people kindly affluence , [their]305-people inexplosive religion , [their]305-people dislike of paper - bags , orange - peel , and broken bottles . [A Radical]2182-a radical out and out , [she]112-lucy learnt to speak with horror of [Suburbia]1303-suburbia . Life , so far as [she]112-lucy troubled to conceive it , was a circle of [rich , pleasant people , with identical interests and identical foes]1304-rich , pleasant people , with identical interests and identical foes . In this circle , [one]2064-one thought , married , and died . Outside it were poverty and vulgarity for ever trying to enter , just as the [London]1-london fog tries to enter [the pine - woods]838-the pine - woods pouring through the gaps in [the northern hills]1307-the northern hills . But , in [Italy]11-italy , where [any one who chooses]1308-any one who chooses may warm [himself]1308-any one who chooses in equality , as in the sun , this conception of life vanished . [Her]112-lucy senses expanded ; [she]112-lucy felt that there was [no one whom [she]112-lucy might not get to like]1309-no one whom she might not get to like , that social barriers were irremovable , doubtless , but not particularly high . [You]1310-you jump over them just as [you]1310-you jump into [[a peasant]1311-a peasant 's olive - yard in [the Apennines]18-the apennines]1312-a peasant 's olive - yard in the apennines , and [he]1311-a peasant is glad to see [you]1310-you . [She]112-lucy returned with new eyes .

So did [Cecil]198-cecil ; but [Italy]11-italy had quickened [Cecil]198-cecil , not to tolerance , but to irritation . [He]198-cecil saw that the local society was narrow , but , instead of saying , " Does that very much matter ? "[198-cecil] [he]198-cecil rebelled , and tried to substitute for it [the society [he]198-cecil called broad]1313-the society he called broad . [He]198-cecil did not realize that [Lucy]112-lucy had consecrated [her]112-lucy environment by the thousand little civilities that create a tenderness in time , and that though [her]112-lucy eyes saw its defects , [her]112-lucy heart refused to despise it entirely . Nor did [he]198-cecil realize a more important point - that if [she]112-lucy was too great for [this society]1314-this society , [she]112-lucy was too great for [all society]1315-all society , and had reached the stage where personal intercourse would alone satisfy [her]112-lucy . [A rebel [she]112-lucy was , but not of the kind [he]198-cecil understood]1316-a rebel she was , but not of the kind he understood - [a rebel who desired , not a wider [dwelling - room]1318-dwelling - room , but equality beside [the man [she]112-lucy loved]1319-the man she loved . For [Italy]11-italy was offering [her]112-lucy the most priceless of all possessions - [her]112-lucy own soul]1317-a rebel who desired , not a wider dwelling - room , but equality beside the man she loved . for italy was offering her the most priceless of all possessions - her own soul .

Playing bumble - puppy with [Minnie Beebe]223-minnie , niece to [the rector]1320-the rector , and aged thirteen - an ancient and most honourable game , which consists in striking tennis - balls high into the air , so that they fall over the net and immoderately bounce ; some hit [Mrs. Honeychurch]152-mrs. honeychurch ; others are lost . The sentence is confused , but the better illustrates [Lucy]112-lucy 's state of mind , for [she]112-lucy was trying to talk to [Mr. Beebe]116-mr. beebe at the same time .

" Oh , it has been such a nuisance - first [he]198-cecil , then [they]2775-they - [no one]2114-no one knowing what [they]2775-they wanted , and [every one]2159-every one so tiresome . "[112-lucy]

" But [they]2775-they really are coming now , "[116-mr. beebe] said [Mr. Beebe]116-mr. beebe . " [I]152-mrs. honeychurch shall hate those [Miss Alans]149-the miss alans ! "[152-mrs. honeychurch] [Mrs. Honeychurch]152-mrs. honeychurch cried . [Freddy]121-freddy possessed to a high degree the power of lashing [little girls]1326-little girls to fury , and in half a minute [he]121-freddy had transformed [Minnie]223-minnie from [a well - mannered child]1327-a well - mannered child into [a howling wilderness]1328-a howling wilderness . " [Emerson]149-the miss alans , [Freddy]121-freddy ? Do [you]121-freddy know what [Emersons]141-the emersons [they]141-the emersons are ? "[152-mrs. honeychurch]

" [I]1342-i trust [they]141-the emersons are the right sort of person . Chapter XI : [In [Mrs. Vyse]228-mrs. vyse 's Well - Appointed [Flat

[Lucy]112-lucy - to descend from bright heaven to [earth]715-earth , whereon there are shadows because there are [hills]655-hills - [Lucy]112-lucy was at first plunged into despair , but settled after a little thought that it did not matter the very least . Several days passed . Then [she]112-lucy had a letter from [Miss Bartlett]111-miss bartlett . " [Miss Lavish]128-miss lavish can not have told [you]236-dear charlotte much about [me]238-secrecy , for [I]238-secrecy am not at [Windy Corner]6-windy corner at all , but here . " [Yours]236-dear charlotte affectionately ,[112-lucy]

" [L. M. Honeychurch]237-l. m. honeychurch . "[238-secrecy]

[Secrecy]238-secrecy has this disadvantage : [we]1390-we lose the sense of proportion ; [we]1390-we can not tell whether [our]1390-we secret is important or not . Were [Lucy]112-lucy and [[her]112-lucy cousin]314-her cousin closeted with a great thing which would destroy [Cecil]198-cecil 's life if [he]198-cecil discovered it , or with a little thing which [he]198-cecil would laugh at ? [Miss Bartlett]111-miss bartlett suggested the former . Perhaps [she]111-miss bartlett was right . It had become a great thing now . Left to [herself]112-lucy , [Lucy]112-lucy would have told [[her]112-lucy mother]442-her mother and [[her]112-lucy lover]2799-her lover ingenuously , and it would have remained a little thing . " [Emerson]149-the miss alans , not [Harris]233-mr. harris "[112-lucy] ; it was only that a few weeks ago . [She]112-lucy tried to tell [Cecil]198-cecil even now when [they]1394-they were laughing about [some beautiful lady who had smitten [his]198-cecil heart at [school]1396-school]1395-some beautiful lady who had smitten his heart at school . But [her]112-lucy body behaved so ridiculously that [she]112-lucy stopped .

[She]112-lucy and [her]112-lucy secret stayed ten days longer in [the deserted Metropolis]1397-the deserted metropolis visiting the scenes [they]1394-they were to know so well later on . It did [her]112-lucy no harm , [Cecil]198-cecil thought , to learn the framework of society , while society itself was absent on [the golf - links]1398-the golf - links or [the moors]1399-the moors . The weather was cool , and it did [her]112-lucy no harm . In spite of the season , [Mrs. Vyse]228-mrs. vyse managed to scrape together a dinner - party consisting entirely of [the grandchildren of [famous people]1401-famous people]1400-the grandchildren of famous people . The food was poor , but the talk had a witty weariness that impressed [the girl]333-the girl . [One]239-one was tired of everything , it seemed . [One]239-one launched into enthusiasms only to collapse gracefully , and pick [oneself]239-one up amid sympathetic laughter . In this atmosphere [the Pension Bertolini]110-the bertolini and [Windy Corner]6-windy corner appeared equally crude , and [Lucy]112-lucy saw that [her]112-lucy [London]1-london career would estrange [her]112-lucy a little from all that [she]112-lucy had loved in the past .

[The grandchildren]1403-the grandchildren asked [her]112-lucy to play the piano .

[She]112-lucy played [Schumann]240-schumann . " Now some Beethoven "[112-lucy] called [Cecil]198-cecil , when the querulous beauty of the music had died . [She]112-lucy shook [her]112-lucy head and played [Schumann]240-schumann again . The melody rose , unprofitably magical . It broke ; it was resumed broken , not marching once from the cradle to the grave . The sadness of the incomplete - the sadness that is often Life , but should never be Art - throbbed in its disjected phrases , and made the nerves of [the audience]527-the audience throb . Not thus had [she]112-lucy played on the little draped piano at [the Bertolini]110-the bertolini , and " Too much [Schumann]240-schumann "[112-lucy] was not the remark that [Mr. Beebe]116-mr. beebe had passed to [himself]116-mr. beebe when [she]112-lucy returned .

When [the guests]1405-the guests were gone , and [Lucy]112-lucy had gone to bed , [Mrs. Vyse]228-mrs. vyse paced up and down [the drawing - room]358-the drawing - room , discussing [her]228-mrs. vyse little party with [[her]228-mrs. vyse son]2429-her son . [Mrs. Vyse]228-mrs. vyse was [a nice woman]1408-a nice woman , but [her]228-mrs. vyse personality , like many another 's , had been swamped by [London]1-london , for it needs a strong head to live among [many people]1409-many people . The too vast orb of [her]228-mrs. vyse fate had crushed [her]228-mrs. vyse ; and [she]228-mrs. vyse had seen too many seasons , too [many cities]1410-many cities , [too many men]1411-too many men , for [her]228-mrs. vyse abilities , and even with [Cecil]198-cecil [she]228-mrs. vyse was mechanical , and behaved as if [he]198-cecil was not [one son]1412-one son , but , so to speak , [a filial crowd]1413-a filial crowd .

" Make [Lucy]112-lucy one of [us]2865-us , "[228-mrs. vyse] [she]228-mrs. vyse said , looking round intelligently at the end of each sentence , and straining [her]228-mrs. vyse lips apart until [she]228-mrs. vyse spoke again . " [Lucy]112-lucy is becoming wonderful - wonderful . "[228-mrs. vyse]

" [Her]112-lucy music always was wonderful . "[228-mrs. vyse]

" Yes , but [she]112-lucy is purging off the Honeychurch taint , most excellent Honeychurches , but [you]198-cecil know what [I]228-mrs. vyse mean . [She]112-lucy is not always quoting [servants]2866-servants , or asking [one]2064-one how the pudding is made . "[228-mrs. vyse]

" [Italy]11-italy has done it . "[228-mrs. vyse]

"[1416-he]

Chapter XII : [Twelfth Chapter]77-twelfth chapter

It was a Saturday afternoon , gay and brilliant after abundant rains , and the spirit of youth dwelt in it , though the season was now autumn . All that was gracious triumphed . As [the motorcars]1422-the motorcars passed through [Summer Street]2627-summer street [they]1422-the motorcars raised only a little dust , and [their]1422-the motorcars stench was soon dispersed by the wind and replaced by the scent of the wet birches or of [the pines]1424-the pines . [Mr. Beebe]116-mr. beebe , at leisure for life 's amenities , leant over [[his]116-mr. beebe Rectory gate]1425-his rectory gate . [Freddy]121-freddy leant by [him]116-mr. beebe , smoking a pendant pipe .

" Suppose [we]2876-we go and hinder [those new people]2877-those new people opposite for a little . "[121-freddy]

" M'm . "[121-freddy]

" [They]2877-those new people might amuse [you]116-mr. beebe . "[121-freddy]

[Freddy]121-freddy , whom [his]121-freddy fellow - creatures never amused , suggested that [the new people]1426-the new people might be feeling a bit busy , and so on , since [they]1426-the new people had only just moved in .

" [I]116-mr. beebe suggested [we]2876-we should hinder [them]1426-the new people , "[116-mr. beebe] said [Mr. Beebe]116-mr. beebe . " [They]1426-the new people are worth it . "[116-mr. beebe] Unlatching the gate , [he]121-freddy sauntered over the triangular green to [Cissie Villa]207-cissie villa . " Hullo ! "[121-freddy] [he]121-freddy cried , shouting in at the open door , through which much squalor was visible .

[The passage]1068-the passage was blocked by a wardrobe , which [the removal men]1429-the removal men had failed to carry up [the stairs]1430-the stairs . [Mr. Beebe]116-mr. beebe edged round [it]1431-it with difficulty . [The sitting - room]1432-the sitting - room [itself]1432-the sitting - room was blocked with books .

Then [Freddy]121-freddy hurled one of the thunderbolts of youth . [Mr. Beebe]116-mr. beebe felt bound to assist [[his]116-mr. beebe young friend]1445-his young friend , and led the way out of [the house]880-the house and into [the pine - woods]838-the pine - woods . How glorious it was ! For a little time the voice of [old Mr. Emerson]149-the miss alans pursued [them]1448-them dispensing good wishes and philosophy . It ceased , and [they]1448-them only heard the fair wind blowing the bracken and the trees . [Mr. Beebe , who could be silent , but who could not bear silence]1449-mr. beebe , who could be silent , but who could not bear silence , was compelled to chatter , since the expedition looked like a failure , and neither of [[his]116-mr. beebe companions]1450-his companions would utter a word . [He]116-mr. beebe spoke of [Florence]14-florence . " And what a coincidence that [you]115-george should meet [Mr. Vyse]200-mr. vyse ! Did [you]115-george realize that [you]115-george would find all the Pension [Bertolini]110-the bertolini down here ? "[116-mr. beebe]

" [I]116-mr. beebe did not . [Miss Lavish]128-miss lavish told [me]116-mr. beebe . "[116-mr. beebe]

" When [I]116-mr. beebe was [a young man]516-a young man , [I]116-mr. beebe always meant to write a ' History of Coincidence . ' "[116-mr. beebe]

No enthusiasm .

" Though , as a matter of fact , coincidences are much rarer than [we]2920-we suppose . For example , it is n't purely coincidentally that [you]115-george are here now , when [one]2064-one comes to reflect . "[116-mr. beebe]

" It is . [I]115-george have reflected . It is Fate . Everything is Fate . [We]2920-we are flung together by [Fate]185-fate , drawn apart by Fate - flung together , drawn apart . The twelve winds blow [us]2920-we - [we]2920-we settle nothing - "[115-george]

" [You]115-george have not reflected at all , "[332-the clergyman] rapped [the clergyman]332-the clergyman . " [Italy]11-italy . "[115-george]

" And where did [you]115-george meet [Mr. Vyse]200-mr. vyse , who is going to marry [Miss Honeychurch]112-lucy ? "[332-the clergyman]

" [National Gallery]2922-national gallery . "[115-george]

"[332-the clergyman]

[Mr. Beebe]116-mr. beebe slid away from such heavy treatment of the subject . But [he]116-mr. beebe was infinitely tolerant of [the young]1062-the young , and had no desire to snub [George]115-george .

" And so for this and for other reasons [my]116-mr. beebe ' History of Coincidence ' is still to write . "[116-mr. beebe]

Silence .

Silence .

" Here [we]2923-we are ! "[121-freddy] called [Freddy]121-freddy .

" Oh , good ! "[116-mr. beebe] exclaimed [Mr. Beebe]116-mr. beebe , mopping [his]116-mr. beebe brow .

" In there 's [the pond]2925-the pond . [I]116-mr. beebe wish it was bigger , "[116-mr. beebe] [he]116-mr. beebe added apologetically .

[They]1453-they climbed down [a slippery bank of pine - needles]1454-a slippery bank of pine - needles . There lay [the pond]2925-the pond , set in [its]2925-the pond little alp of green - only [a pond]2918-a pond , but large enough to contain [the human body]1457-the human body , and pure enough to reflect the sky . On account of the rains , the waters had flooded the surrounding grass , which showed like a beautiful emerald path , tempting these feet towards [the central pool]1458-the central pool .

" It 's distinctly successful , as [ponds]2926-ponds go , "[116-mr. beebe] said [Mr. Beebe]116-mr. beebe . " No apologies are necessary for [the pond]2925-the pond . "[116-mr. beebe]

[George]115-george sat down where the ground was dry , and drearily unlaced [his]115-george boots .

" Are n't those masses of willow - herb splendid ? [I]116-mr. beebe love willow - herb in seed . What 's the name of this aromatic plant ? "[116-mr. beebe]

[No one]2114-no one knew , or seemed to care .

" These abrupt changes of vegetation - this little spongeous tract of water plants , and on either side of it all the growths are tough or brittle - heather , bracken , hurts , pines . Very charming , very charming .[116-mr. beebe]

" [Mr. Beebe]116-mr. beebe , are n't [you]116-mr. beebe bathing ? "[121-freddy] called [Freddy]121-freddy , as [he]121-freddy stripped [himself]121-freddy .

" Apooshoo , kouf . "[121-freddy]

[Mr. Beebe]116-mr. beebe , who was hot , and who always acquiesced where possible , looked around [him]116-mr. beebe . [He]116-mr. beebe could detect [no parishioners]1466-no parishioners except the pine - trees , rising up steeply on all sides , and gesturing to each other against the blue . How glorious it was ! [Water]79-water , sky , evergreens , a wind - these things not even the seasons can touch , and surely they lie beyond the intrusion of [man]2244-man ?

" [I]121-freddy may as well wash too "[121-freddy] ; and soon [his]121-freddy garments made a third little pile on the sward , and [he]121-freddy too asserted the wonder of [the water]1278-the water .

It was ordinary water , nor was there very much of it , and , as [Freddy]121-freddy said , it reminded one of swimming in a salad . [The three gentlemen]1471-the three gentlemen rotated in [the pool]2764-the pool breast high , after the fashion of [the nymphs in Gotterdammerung]1473-the nymphs in gotterdammerung . That evening and all that night the water ran away . On the morrow [the pool]2764-the pool had shrunk to its old size and lost its glory . It had been a call to the blood and to the relaxed will , a passing benediction whose influence did not pass , a holiness , a spell , a momentary chalice for youth .

Chapter XIII : How [Miss Bartlett]111-miss bartlett 's Boiler Was So Tiresome

How often had [Lucy]112-lucy rehearsed this bow , this interview ! But [she]112-lucy had always rehearsed them indoors , and with certain accessories , which surely [we]1494-we have a right to assume . Who could foretell that [she]112-lucy and [George]115-george would meet in the rout of [a civilization]1495-a civilization , amidst an army of coats and collars and boots that lay wounded over [the sunlit earth]1496-the sunlit earth ? [She]112-lucy had imagined [a young [Mr. Emerson]149-the miss alans , who might be shy or morbid or indifferent or furtively impudent . [She]112-lucy was prepared for all of these . But [she]112-lucy had never imagined [one who would be happy and greet [her]112-lucy with the shout of the morning star]1498-one who would be happy and greet her with the shout of the morning star .

Indoors [herself]112-lucy , partaking of tea with [old Mrs. Butterworth]134-mrs. butterworth]1497-a young mr. emerson , who might be shy or morbid or indifferent or furtively impudent . she was prepared for all of these . but she had never imagined one who would be happy and greet her with the shout of the morning star . indoors herself , partaking of tea with old mrs. butterworth , [she]112-lucy reflected that it is impossible to foretell the future with any degree of accuracy , that it is impossible to rehearse life . A fault in the scenery , a face in [the audience]527-the audience , an irruption of [the audience]527-the audience on to the stage , and all [our]1494-we carefully planned gestures mean nothing , or mean too much . " [I]112-lucy will bow , "[112-lucy] [she]112-lucy had thought . " [I]112-lucy will not shake hands with [him]198-cecil . That will be just the proper thing . "[112-lucy] [She]112-lucy had bowed - but to whom ? To [gods]2516-gods , to [heroes]2515-heroes , to the nonsense of [school - girls]1503-school - girls ! [She]112-lucy had bowed across the rubbish that cumbers [the world]2079-the world .

So ran [her]112-lucy thoughts , while [her]112-lucy faculties were busy with [Cecil]198-cecil . It was another of those dreadful engagement calls . [Mrs. Butterworth]134-mrs. butterworth had wanted to see [him]198-cecil , and [he]198-cecil did not want to be seen . [He]198-cecil did not want to hear about hydrangeas , why [they]1505-they change [their]1505-they colour at [the seaside]1506-the seaside . [He]198-cecil did not want to join the C. O. S. When cross [he]198-cecil was always elaborate , and made long , clever answers where " Yes "[198-cecil] or " No "[198-cecil] would have done . [Lucy]112-lucy soothed [him]198-cecil and tinkered at the conversation in a way that promised well for [their]1507-their married peace . [No one]2114-no one is perfect , and surely it is wiser to discover the imperfections before wedlock . [Miss Bartlett]111-miss bartlett , indeed , though not in word , had taught [the girl]333-the girl that this [our]1510-our life contains nothing satisfactory . [Lucy]112-lucy , though [she]112-lucy disliked [the teacher]520-the teacher , regarded the teaching as profound , and applied it to [[her]112-lucy lover]2799-her lover .

" [Lucy]112-lucy , "[442-her mother] said [[her]112-lucy mother]442-her mother , when [they]1507-their got [home]376-home , " is anything the matter with [Cecil]198-cecil ? "[442-her mother]

[The two civilizations]1515-the two civilizations had clashed - [Cecil]198-cecil hinted that [they]1515-the two civilizations might - and [she]112-lucy was dazzled and bewildered , as though the radiance that lies behind all civilization had blinded [her]112-lucy eyes . Good taste and bad taste were only catchwords , garments of diverse cut ; and music itself dissolved to a whisper through pine - trees , where the song is not distinguishable from the comic song .

[She]112-lucy remained in much embarrassment , while [Mrs. Honeychurch]152-mrs. honeychurch changed [her]152-mrs. honeychurch frock for dinner ; and every now and then [she]112-lucy said a word , and made things no better . There was no concealing the fact , [Cecil]198-cecil had meant to be supercilious , and [he]198-cecil had succeeded . And [Lucy]112-lucy - [she]112-lucy knew not why - wished that the trouble could have come at any other time .

" Go and dress , [dear]2075-dear ; [you]2075-dear 'll be late . "[112-lucy]

[She]112-lucy obeyed , but loitered disconsolately at the landing window . [It]1516-it faced north , so there was little view , and no view of the sky . Now , as in the winter , the pine - trees hung close to [her]112-lucy eyes . One connected the landing window with depression . No definite problem menaced [her]112-lucy , but [she]112-lucy sighed to [herself]112-lucy , " Oh , dear , what shall [I]112-lucy do , what shall [I]112-lucy do ? "[152-mrs. honeychurch] And , though nothing is perfect , [Lucy]112-lucy felt for the moment that [[her]112-lucy mother]442-her mother and [Windy Corner]6-windy corner and [the Weald]28-the weald in the declining sun were perfect .

So the grittiness went out of life . It generally did at [Windy Corner]6-windy corner . At the last minute , when the social machine was clogged hopelessly , [one member or other of [the family]2597-the family]1528-one member or other of the family poured in a drop of oil . Chapter XIV : How [Lucy]112-lucy Faced the External Situation Bravely

Of course [Miss Bartlett]111-miss bartlett accepted . And , equally of course , [she]111-miss bartlett felt sure that [she]111-miss bartlett would prove a nuisance , and begged to be given [an inferior spare room]1553-an inferior spare room - something with no view , anything . [Her]111-miss bartlett love to [Lucy]112-lucy . And , equally of course , [George Emerson]115-george could come to tennis on the Sunday week .

[Lucy]112-lucy faced the situation bravely , though , like most of [us]1554-us , [she]112-lucy only faced the situation that encompassed [her]112-lucy . [She]112-lucy never gazed inwards . If at times strange images rose from the depths , [she]112-lucy put them down to nerves . When [Cecil]198-cecil brought [the Emersons]141-the emersons to [Summer Street]5-summer street , it had upset [her]112-lucy nerves . [Charlotte]111-miss bartlett would burnish up past foolishness , and this might upset [her]111-miss bartlett nerves . [She]111-miss bartlett was nervous at night . When [she]111-miss bartlett talked to [George]115-george - [they]1555-they met again almost immediately at [the Rectory]2082-the rectory - [his]115-george voice moved [her]111-miss bartlett deeply , and [she]111-miss bartlett wished to remain near [him]115-george . How dreadful if [she]111-miss bartlett really wished to remain near [him]115-george ! Of course , the wish was due to nerves , which love to play such perverse tricks upon [us]1557-us . Once [she]111-miss bartlett had suffered from " things that came out of nothing and meant [she]111-miss bartlett did n't know what . "[198-cecil] Now [Cecil]198-cecil had explained psychology to [her]111-miss bartlett one wet afternoon , and all the troubles of youth in [an unknown world]1558-an unknown world could be dismissed .

It is obvious enough for [the reader]1559-the reader to conclude , " [She]111-miss bartlett loves [young Emerson]115-george . "[1559-the reader] [A reader in [Lucy]112-lucy 's place]1560-a reader in lucy 's place would not find it obvious . Life is easy to chronicle , but bewildering to practice , and [we]1557-us welcome " nerves "[1559-the reader] or any other shibboleth that will cloak [our]1557-us personal desire . [She]111-miss bartlett loved [Cecil]198-cecil ; [George]115-george made [her]111-miss bartlett nervous ; will [the reader]1559-the reader explain to [her]111-miss bartlett that the phrases should have been reversed ?

But the external situation - [she]111-miss bartlett will face that bravely .

The meeting at [the Rectory]2082-the rectory had passed off well enough . Standing between [Mr. Beebe]116-mr. beebe and [Cecil]198-cecil , [she]111-miss bartlett had made a few temperate allusions to [Italy]11-italy , and [George]115-george had replied . [She]111-miss bartlett was anxious to show that [she]111-miss bartlett was not shy , and was glad that [he]115-george did not seem shy either .

" [A nice fellow]2998-a nice fellow , "[116-mr. beebe] said [Mr. Beebe]116-mr. beebe afterwards " [He]2998-a nice fellow will work off [his]2998-a nice fellow crudities in time . [I]116-mr. beebe rather mistrust young men who slip into life gracefully . "[116-mr. beebe]

[Lucy]112-lucy said , " [He]2998-a nice fellow seems in better spirits . [He]2998-a nice fellow laughs more . "[112-lucy]

" Yes , "[332-the clergyman] replied [the clergyman]332-the clergyman . " [He]2998-a nice fellow is waking up . "[332-the clergyman]

That was all . But , as the week wore on , more of [her]111-miss bartlett defences fell , and [she]111-miss bartlett entertained an image that had physical beauty . In spite of the clearest directions , [Miss Bartlett]111-miss bartlett contrived to bungle [her]111-miss bartlett arrival . [She]111-miss bartlett was due at [the South - Eastern station]1564-the south - eastern station at [Dorking]27-dorking , whither [Mrs. Honeychurch]152-mrs. honeychurch drove to meet [her]111-miss bartlett . [She]111-miss bartlett arrived at [the [London]1-london and [Brighton]81-brighton station]1565-the london and brighton station , and had to hire [a cab]857-a cab up . [Miss Bartlett]111-miss bartlett considered . " For instance , [the driver]2165-the driver . [I]111-miss bartlett saw [him]2165-the driver looking through the bushes at [you]112-lucy , remember [he]2165-the driver had a violet between [his]2165-the driver teeth . "[111-miss bartlett]

" [We]3017-we must think of every possibility . "[333-the girl]

" Oh , it 's all right . "[112-lucy]

" Or perhaps [old Mr. Emerson]115-george knows . In fact , [he]2165-the driver is certain to know . "[333-the girl]

" [I]112-lucy do n't care if [he]2165-the driver does . [I]112-lucy was grateful to [you]112-lucy for [your]112-lucy letter , but even if the news does get round , [I]112-lucy think [I]112-lucy can trust [Cecil]198-cecil to laugh at it . "[112-lucy]

" To contradict it ? "[333-the girl]

" No , to laugh at it . "[112-lucy] But [she]112-lucy knew in [her]112-lucy heart that [she]112-lucy could not trust [him]1592-him , for [he]1592-him desired [her]112-lucy untouched .

" Very well , [dear]2075-dear , [you]112-lucy know best . Perhaps [gentlemen]2145-gentlemen are different to what [they]2145-gentlemen were when [I]333-the girl was young . [Ladies]661-ladies are certainly different . "[333-the girl]

" Now , [Charlotte]111-miss bartlett ! "[112-lucy] [She]112-lucy struck at [her]112-lucy playfully . " [You]111-miss bartlett kind , anxious thing . What WOULD [you]112-lucy have [me]112-lucy do ? First [you]112-lucy say ' Do n't tell ' ; and then [you]112-lucy say , ' Tell ' . Which is it to be ? Quick ! "[112-lucy]

[Miss Bartlett]111-miss bartlett sighed " [I]111-miss bartlett am no match for [you]112-lucy in conversation , [dearest]2089-dearest . [You]112-lucy will never forgive [me]111-miss bartlett . "[111-miss bartlett]

" Shall [we]3023-we go out , then . [They]3024-they will smash all the china if [we]3023-we do n't . "[333-the girl]

For the air rang with the shrieks of [Minnie]223-minnie , who was being scalped with a teaspoon .

" [Dear]2075-dear , one moment - [we]3023-we may not have this chance for a chat again . Have [you]112-lucy seen [the young one]3026-the young one yet ? "[111-miss bartlett]

" Yes , [I]111-miss bartlett have . "[111-miss bartlett]

"[111-miss bartlett]

" Once [a cad]3028-a cad , always [a cad]3028-a cad . That is [my]111-miss bartlett poor opinion . "[111-miss bartlett]

[Lucy]112-lucy paused . " [Cecil]198-cecil said one day - and [I]112-lucy thought it so profound - that there are two kinds of [cads]3031-cads - [the conscious]3032-the conscious and the subconscious . "[112-lucy] [She]112-lucy paused again , to be sure of doing justice to [Cecil]198-cecil 's profundity . Through the window [she]112-lucy saw [Cecil]198-cecil [himself]198-cecil , turning over the pages of a novel . It was a new one from [[Smith]256-smith 's library]1593-smith 's library . [[Her]112-lucy mother]442-her mother must have returned from [the station]1595-the station .

" Once [a cad]3028-a cad , always [a cad]3028-a cad , "[111-miss bartlett] droned [Miss Bartlett]111-miss bartlett .

" What [I]1596-i mean by subconscious is that [Emerson]115-george lost [his]115-george head . [I]1596-i fell into all those violets , and [he]115-george was silly and surprised . [I]1596-i do n't think [we]3035-we ought to blame [him]115-george very much . [He]115-george has improved ; [he]115-george does n't always look as if [he]115-george 's going to burst into tears . [Papa]257-papa was to do with journalism , but is rheumatic and has retired . There ! Now for [the garden]2185-the garden . "[1596-i] [She]1596-i took hold of [[her]1596-i guest]1597-her guest by the arm . " Suppose [we]3045-we do n't talk about this silly Italian business any more . [Lucy]112-lucy thought this rather a good speech . [The reader]1559-the reader may have detected an unfortunate slip in it . Whether [Miss Bartlett]111-miss bartlett detected the slip one can not say , for it is impossible to penetrate into the minds of [elderly people]1599-elderly people . [She]1596-i might have spoken further , but [they]1600-they were interrupted by the entrance of [[her]1596-i hostess]1601-her hostess . Explanations took place , and in the midst of [them]1600-they [Lucy]112-lucy escaped , the images throbbing a little more vividly in [her]112-lucy brain .

Chapter XV : The Disaster Within

The Sunday after [Miss Bartlett]111-miss bartlett 's arrival was a glorious day , like most of the days of that year . In [the Weald]28-the weald , autumn approached , breaking up the green monotony of summer , touching [the parks]1602-the parks with the grey bloom of mist , the beech - trees with russet , the oak - trees with gold . Up on [the heights]1603-the heights , battalions of black pines witnessed the change , [themselves]1600-they unchangeable . [Either country]1604-either country was spanned by a cloudless sky , and in either arose the tinkle of church bells .

[The garden of [Windy Corners]82-windy corners]1605-the garden of windy corners was deserted except for a red book , which lay sunning itself upon [the gravel path]1606-the gravel path . From [the house]880-the house came incoherent sounds , as of [females preparing for worship]1608-females preparing for worship . " [The men]1531-the men say [they]1531-the men wo n't go "[1608-females preparing for worship] - " Well , [I]223-minnie do n't blame [them]1531-the men "[223-minnie] - [Minnie]223-minnie says , " need [she]111-miss bartlett go ? "[223-minnie] - " Tell [her]111-miss bartlett , no nonsense "[1608-females preparing for worship] - " [Anne]210-anne ! [Mary]211-mary ! Hook [me]223-minnie behind ! "[223-minnie] - " [Dearest Lucia]120-lucia , may [I]1608-females preparing for worship trespass upon [you]120-lucia for a pin ? "[1608-females preparing for worship] For [Miss Bartlett]111-miss bartlett had announced that [she]111-miss bartlett at all events was one for [church]525-church .

The sun rose higher on its journey , guided , not by [Phaethon]183-phaethon , but by [Apollo]258-apollo , competent , unswerving , divine . Its rays fell on [the ladies]300-the ladies whenever [they]300-the ladies advanced towards the bedroom windows ; on [Mr. Beebe]116-mr. beebe down at [Summer Street]5-summer street as [he]116-mr. beebe smiled over a letter from [Miss Catharine Alan]144-miss alan ; on [George Emerson]115-george cleaning [[his]115-george father]347-his father 's boots ; and lastly , to complete the catalogue of memorable things , on the red book mentioned previously . [The ladies]300-the ladies move , [Mr. Beebe]116-mr. beebe moves , [George]115-george moves , and movement may engender shadow . But this book lies motionless , to be caressed all the morning by the sun and to raise its covers slightly , as though acknowledging the caress .

Presently [Lucy]112-lucy steps out of [the drawing - room]358-the drawing - room window . [Her]112-lucy new cerise dress has been a failure , and makes [her]112-lucy look tawdry and wan . At [her]112-lucy throat is a garnet brooch , on [her]112-lucy finger a ring set with rubies - an engagement ring . [Her]112-lucy eyes are bent to [the Weald]28-the weald . [She]112-lucy frowns a little - not in anger , but as [a brave child]1614-a brave child frowns when [he]1614-a brave child is trying not to cry . In all that expanse [no human eye]1615-no human eye is looking at [her]112-lucy , and [she]112-lucy may frown unrebuked and measure the spaces that yet survive between [Apollo]258-apollo and [the western hills]1616-the western hills .

" [Lucy]112-lucy ! [Lucy]112-lucy ! What 's that book ? Who 's been taking a book out of the shelf and leaving it about to spoil ? "[112-lucy]

" It 's only the library book that [Cecil]198-cecil 's been reading . "[112-lucy]

" But pick it up , and do n't stand idling there like a flamingo . "[112-lucy]

[Lucy]112-lucy picked up the book and glanced at the title listlessly , Under [a Loggia]51-the loggia . [She]112-lucy no longer read novels [herself]112-lucy , devoting all [her]112-lucy spare time to solid literature in the hope of catching [Cecil]198-cecil up . It was dreadful how little [she]112-lucy knew , and even when [she]112-lucy thought [she]112-lucy knew a thing , like [the Italian painters]1617-the italian painters , [she]112-lucy found [she]112-lucy had forgotten it . Only this morning [she]112-lucy had confused [Francesco Francia]259-francesco francia with [Piero della Francesca]260-piero della francesca , and [Cecil]198-cecil had said , " What ! [you]112-lucy are n't forgetting [[your]112-lucy [Italy]11-italy]3047-your italy already ? "[198-cecil] And this too had lent anxiety to [her]112-lucy eyes when [she]112-lucy saluted the dear view and [the dear garden]1618-the dear garden in the foreground , and above them , scarcely conceivable elsewhere , the dear sun .

" [Lucy]112-lucy - have [you]112-lucy a sixpence for [Minnie]223-minnie and a shilling for [yourself]112-lucy ? "[112-lucy]

[She]112-lucy hastened in to [[her]112-lucy mother]442-her mother , who was rapidly working [herself]442-her mother into a Sunday fluster .

" It 's a special collection - [I]112-lucy forget what for . [I]112-lucy do beg , no vulgar clinking in the plate with halfpennies ; see that [Minnie]223-minnie has a nice bright sixpence . " Oh , [Mrs. Honeychurch]152-mrs. honeychurch - "[442-her mother] from [the upper regions]1620-the upper regions .

" [Minnie]223-minnie , do n't be late . Here comes the horse "[112-lucy] - it was always the horse , never [the carriage]865-the carriage . " Where 's [Charlotte]111-miss bartlett ? [Poor Charlotte]153-poor charlotte - How [I]112-lucy do detest blouses ! [Minnie]223-minnie ! "[112-lucy]

Paganism is infectious - more infectious than diphtheria or piety - and [[the Rector]1320-the rector 's niece]1623-the rector 's niece was taken to [church]525-church protesting . As usual , [she]1623-the rector 's niece did n't see why . Why should n't [she]1623-the rector 's niece sit in the sun with [the young men]1625-the young men ? [The young men]1625-the young men , who had now appeared , mocked [her]1623-the rector 's niece with ungenerous words . [Mrs. Honeychurch]152-mrs. honeychurch defended orthodoxy , and in the midst of the confusion [Miss Bartlett]111-miss bartlett [, dressed in the very height of the fashion]1627-, dressed in the very height of the fashion , came strolling down [the stairs]1430-the stairs .

" [Dear Marian]211-mary , [I]111-miss bartlett am very sorry , but [I]111-miss bartlett have no small change - nothing but sovereigns and half crowns . Could [any one]349-any one give [me]111-miss bartlett - "[111-miss bartlett]

" Good - bye ! Be good ! "[198-cecil] called out [Cecil]198-cecil .

[Lucy]112-lucy bit [her]112-lucy lip , for the tone was sneering . On the subject of " [church]525-church and so on "[198-cecil] [they]1630-they had had rather an unsatisfactory conversation . [He]198-cecil had said that [people]305-people ought to overhaul [themselves]305-people , and [she]112-lucy did not want to overhaul [herself]112-lucy ; [she]112-lucy did not know it was done . [Honest orthodoxy]261-honest orthodoxy [Cecil]198-cecil respected , but [he]198-cecil always assumed that honesty is the result of a spiritual crisis ; [he]198-cecil could not imagine it as a natural birthright , that might grow heavenward like flowers . All that [he]198-cecil said on this subject pained [her]112-lucy , though [he]198-cecil exuded tolerance from every pore ; somehow [the Emersons]141-the emersons were different .

[She]112-lucy saw [the Emersons]141-the emersons after [church]525-church . There was a line of carriages down [the road]404-the road , and [the Honeychurch vehicle]1634-the honeychurch vehicle happened to be opposite [Cissie Villa]207-cissie villa . " Introduce [me]442-her mother , "[442-her mother] said [[her]112-lucy mother]442-her mother . " Unless [the young man]345-the young man considers that [he]345-the young man knows [me]442-her mother already . "[442-her mother]

[Old Mr. Emerson]115-george claimed [her]112-lucy with much warmth , and said how glad [he]115-george was that [she]112-lucy was going to be married . " [I]152-mrs. honeychurch believe that there was some misunderstanding , "[152-mrs. honeychurch] said [Mrs. Honeychurch]152-mrs. honeychurch uneasily .

" Oh , stop now [you]115-george have come , "[112-lucy] said [Lucy]112-lucy lightly . [She]112-lucy must avoid censuring [Cecil]198-cecil . For it was on [Cecil]198-cecil that [the little episode]1642-the little episode turned , though [his]198-cecil name was never mentioned .

" So [George]115-george says . [He]115-george says that [the Miss Alans]149-the miss alans must go to the wall . Yet it does seem so unkind . "[152-mrs. honeychurch]

" There is only a certain amount of kindness in [the world]2079-the world , "[115-george] said [George]115-george , watching the sunlight flash on the panels of [the passing carriages]1643-the passing carriages .

" Yes ! "[152-mrs. honeychurch] exclaimed [Mrs. Honeychurch]152-mrs. honeychurch . " That 's exactly what [I]152-mrs. honeychurch say . Why all this twiddling and twaddling over [two Miss Alans]3058-two miss alans ? "[152-mrs. honeychurch]

" There is a certain amount of kindness , just as there is a certain amount of light , "[115-george] [he]115-george continued in measured tones . " [We]3059-we cast a shadow on something wherever [we]3059-we stand , and it is no good moving from place to place to save things ; because the shadow always follows . Choose a place where [you]115-george wo n't do harm - yes , choose a place where [you]115-george wo n't do very much harm , and stand in it for all [you]115-george are worth , facing the sunshine . "[115-george]

" Oh , [Mr. Emerson]115-george , [I]152-mrs. honeychurch see [you]115-george 're clever ! "[152-mrs. honeychurch]

[George]115-george 's eyes laughed , and [Lucy]112-lucy suspected that [he]115-george and [[her]112-lucy mother]442-her mother would get on rather well .

" What DO [you]115-george mean ? No , never mind what [you]115-george mean . Do n't explain . [He]121-freddy looks forward to seeing [you]115-george this afternoon . Do [you]115-george play tennis ? Do [you]115-george mind tennis on Sunday - ? "[115-george]

[He]1645-he thanked [her]1646-her , but the walk sounded rather far ; [he]1645-he could only potter about in these days .

[She]1646-her turned to [George]115-george : " And then [he]115-george wants to give up [[his]115-george house]3062-his house to [the Miss Alans]149-the miss alans . "[1646-her]

" [I]115-george know , "[115-george] said [George]115-george , and put [his]115-george arm round [[his]115-george father]347-his father 's neck . [She]112-lucy remembered that in all [his]115-george perversities [he]115-george had never spoken against affection .

[Miss Bartlett]111-miss bartlett approached .

" [You]115-george know [[our]3063-our cousin]3064-our cousin , [Miss Bartlett]111-miss bartlett , "[152-mrs. honeychurch] said [Mrs. Honeychurch]152-mrs. honeychurch pleasantly . " Yes , indeed ! "[310-the old man] said [the old man]310-the old man , and made as if [he]310-the old man would come out of [the garden]2185-the garden to meet [the lady]1169-the lady . [Miss Bartlett]111-miss bartlett promptly got into [the victoria]1209-the victoria . Thus entrenched , [she]111-miss bartlett emitted a formal bow . It was the pension [Bertolini]110-the bertolini again , the dining - table with the decanters of water and wine . It was the old , old battle of [the room]325-the room with the view .

[George]115-george did not respond to the bow . Like [any boy]1653-any boy , [he]115-george blushed and was ashamed ; [he]115-george knew that [the chaperon]1070-the chaperon remembered . [He]115-george said : " [I]115-george - [I]115-george 'll come up to tennis if [I]115-george can manage it , "[115-george] and went into [the house]880-the house . Perhaps anything that [he]115-george did would have pleased [Lucy]112-lucy , but [his]115-george awkwardness went straight to [her]112-lucy heart ; [men]2073-men were not [gods]2516-gods after all , but as human and as clumsy as [girls]624-girls ; even [men]2073-men might suffer from unexplained desires , and need help . To one of [her]112-lucy upbringing , and of [her]112-lucy destination , the weakness of [men]2073-men was a truth unfamiliar , but [she]112-lucy had surmised it at [Florence]14-florence , when [George]115-george threw [her]112-lucy photographs into [the River Arno]47-the river arno .

" [George]115-george , do n't go , "[347-his father] cried [[his]115-george father]347-his father , who thought it a great treat for [people]305-people if [[his]347-his father son]316-his son would talk to [them]305-people . " [George]115-george has been in such good spirits today , and [I]347-his father am sure [he]115-george will end by coming up this afternoon . "[347-his father]

[Lucy]112-lucy caught [[her]112-lucy cousin]314-her cousin 's eye . Something in its mute appeal made [her]112-lucy reckless . " Yes , "[112-lucy] [she]112-lucy said , raising [her]112-lucy voice , " [I]112-lucy do hope [he]115-george will . "[112-lucy] Then [she]112-lucy went to [the carriage]865-the carriage and murmured , " [The old man]310-the old man has n't been told ; [I]112-lucy knew it was all right . "[112-lucy] [Mrs. Honeychurch]152-mrs. honeychurch followed [her]112-lucy , and [they]1666-they drove away .

Satisfactory that [Mr. Emerson]115-george had not been told of the [Florence]14-florence escapade ; yet [Lucy]112-lucy 's spirits should not have leapt up as if [she]112-lucy had sighted the ramparts of heaven . Satisfactory ; yet surely [she]112-lucy greeted it with disproportionate joy . All the way [home]376-home the horses ' hoofs sang a tune to [her]112-lucy : " [He]310-the old man has not told , [he]310-the old man has not told . "[112-lucy] [Her]112-lucy brain expanded the melody : " [He]310-the old man has not told [[his]310-the old man father]347-his father - to whom [he]310-the old man tells all things . It was not an exploit . [He]310-the old man did not laugh at [me]112-lucy when [I]112-lucy had gone . "[112-lucy] [She]112-lucy raised [her]112-lucy hand to [her]112-lucy cheek . " [He]310-the old man does not love [me]112-lucy . No . How terrible if [he]310-the old man did ! But [he]310-the old man has not told . [He]310-the old man will not tell . "[112-lucy]

[She]112-lucy longed to shout the words : " It is all right . It 's a secret between [us]1668-us two for ever . [Cecil]198-cecil will never hear . "[112-lucy] [She]112-lucy was even glad that [Miss Bartlett]111-miss bartlett had made [her]111-miss bartlett promise secrecy , that last dark evening at [Florence]14-florence , when [they]1668-us had knelt packing in [[his]1669-his room]1067-his room . The secret , big or little , was guarded .

[Only three English people]1671-only three english people knew of it in [the world]2079-the world . Thus [she]112-lucy interpreted [her]112-lucy joy . [She]112-lucy greeted [Cecil]198-cecil with unusual radiance , because [she]112-lucy felt so safe . As [he]198-cecil helped [her]112-lucy out of [the carriage]865-the carriage , [she]112-lucy said :

" [The Emersons]141-the emersons have been so nice . [George Emerson]115-george has improved enormously . "[112-lucy]

" How are [[my]198-cecil proteges]3068-my proteges ? "[198-cecil] asked [Cecil]198-cecil , who took no real interest in [them]1674-them , and had long since forgotten [his]198-cecil resolution to bring [them]1674-them to [Windy Corner]6-windy corner for educational purposes .

" [You]112-lucy shall see for [yourself]112-lucy how [[your]112-lucy proteges]3070-your proteges are . [George Emerson]115-george is coming up this afternoon . "[112-lucy] But the bell was ringing for lunch , and , as often happened , [Cecil]198-cecil had paid no great attention to [her]112-lucy remarks . Lunch was a cheerful meal . [Generally Lucy]112-lucy was depressed at meals . [Some one]454-some one had to be soothed - either [Cecil]198-cecil or [Miss Bartlett]111-miss bartlett or a Being not visible to the mortal eye - [a Being who whispered to [her]112-lucy soul]1678-a being who whispered to her soul : " It will not last , this cheerfulness . "[1678-a being who whispered to her soul] But to - day [she]112-lucy felt [she]112-lucy had received a guarantee . [[Her]112-lucy mother]442-her mother would always sit there , [[her]442-her mother brother]831-her brother here . The sun , though it had moved a little since the morning , would never be hidden behind [the western hills]1616-the western hills . After luncheon [they]1682-they asked [her]112-lucy to play . [She]112-lucy had seen [Gluck]264-gluck 's Armide that year , and played from memory the music of [the enchanted garden]1683-the enchanted garden - the music to which [Renaud]265-renaud approaches , beneath the light of an eternal dawn , the music that never gains , never wanes , but ripples for ever like the tideless seas of fairyland . "[198-cecil]

[She]112-lucy closed the instrument .

" Not very dutiful , "[442-her mother] said [[her]112-lucy mother]442-her mother 's voice .

[Lucy]112-lucy 's Sabbath was generally of this amphibious nature . [She]112-lucy kept it without hypocrisy in the morning , and broke it without reluctance in the afternoon . [Mr. Floyd]252-mr. floyd was [[her]112-lucy partner]1689-her partner . [She]112-lucy liked music , but how much better tennis seemed . Chapter XVI : Lying to [George]115-george

But [Lucy]112-lucy had developed since the spring . That is to say , [she]112-lucy was now better able to stifle the emotions of which the conventions and [the world]2079-the world disapprove . Though the danger was greater , [she]112-lucy was not shaken by deep sobs . [She]112-lucy said to [Cecil]198-cecil , " [I]112-lucy am not coming in to tea - tell [mother]2081-mother - [I]112-lucy must write some letters , "[112-lucy] and went up to [[her]112-lucy room]397-her room . Then [she]112-lucy prepared for action . Love felt and returned , love which [our]1721-our bodies exact and [our]1721-our hearts have transfigured , love which is the most real thing that [we]1721-our shall ever meet , reappeared now as [the world]2079-the world 's enemy , and [she]112-lucy must stifle it .

[She]112-lucy sent for [Miss Bartlett]111-miss bartlett .

The contest lay not between love and duty . Perhaps there never is such a contest . It lay between the real and the pretended , and [Lucy]112-lucy 's first aim was to defeat [herself]112-lucy . As [her]112-lucy brain clouded over , as the memory of the views grew dim and the words of the book died away , [she]112-lucy returned to [her]112-lucy old shibboleth of nerves . [She]112-lucy " conquered [her]112-lucy breakdown . "[112-lucy] Tampering with the truth , [she]112-lucy forgot that the truth had ever been . Remembering that [she]112-lucy was engaged to [Cecil]198-cecil , [she]112-lucy compelled [herself]112-lucy to confused remembrances of [George]115-george ; [he]115-george was nothing to [her]112-lucy ; [he]115-george never had been anything ; [he]115-george had behaved abominably ; [she]112-lucy had never encouraged [him]115-george . The armour of falsehood is subtly wrought out of darkness , and hides [a man]632-a man not only from [others]663-others , but from [his]632-a man own soul . In a few moments [Lucy]112-lucy was equipped for battle .

" Something too awful has happened , "[112-lucy] [she]112-lucy began , as soon as [[her]112-lucy cousin]314-her cousin arrived . " Do [you]314-her cousin know anything about [Miss Lavish]128-miss lavish 's novel ? "[112-lucy]

[Miss Bartlett]111-miss bartlett looked surprised , and said that [she]111-miss bartlett had not read the book , nor known that it was published ; [Eleanor]128-miss lavish was [a reticent woman]1726-a reticent woman at heart .

" There is a scene in it . [The hero]3121-the hero and [heroine]3122-heroine make love . Do [you]314-her cousin know about that ? "[111-miss bartlett]

" [Dear]2075-dear - ? "[111-miss bartlett]

Chapter XVII : Lying to [Cecil]198-cecil

[He]198-cecil was bewildered . [He]198-cecil had nothing to say . [He]198-cecil was not even angry , but stood , with a glass of whiskey between [his]198-cecil hands , trying to think what had led [her]112-lucy to such a conclusion .

[She]112-lucy had chosen the moment before bed , when , in accordance with [their]1757-their bourgeois habit , [she]112-lucy always dispensed drinks to [the men]1531-the men . [Freddy]121-freddy and [Mr. Floyd]252-mr. floyd were sure to retire with [their]1757-their glasses , while [Cecil]198-cecil invariably lingered , sipping at [his]198-cecil while [she]112-lucy locked up the sideboard .

" [I]112-lucy am very sorry about it , "[112-lucy] [she]112-lucy said ; " [I]112-lucy have carefully thought things over . [We]3208-we are too different . [I]112-lucy must ask [you]198-cecil to release [me]112-lucy , and try to forget that there ever was [such a foolish girl]3209-such a foolish girl . "[112-lucy]

It was a suitable speech , but [she]112-lucy was more angry than sorry , and [her]112-lucy voice showed it .

" Different - how - how - "[112-lucy]

" [I]112-lucy have n't had a really good education , for one thing , "[112-lucy] [she]112-lucy continued , still on [her]112-lucy knees by the sideboard . " [My]112-lucy Italian trip came too late , and [I]112-lucy am forgetting all that [I]112-lucy learnt there . [I]112-lucy shall never be able to talk to [[your]198-cecil friends]3210-your friends , or behave as [a wife of yours]3211-a wife of yours should . "[112-lucy]

" [I]112-lucy do n't understand [you]198-cecil . [You]198-cecil are n't like [yourself]198-cecil . [You]198-cecil 're tired , [Lucy]112-lucy . "[112-lucy]

" What if [I]112-lucy do ? It does n't prevent [me]112-lucy from realizing the truth . [I]112-lucy ca n't marry [you]198-cecil , and [you]198-cecil will thank [me]112-lucy for saying so some day . "[112-lucy]

" [You]1759-i had that bad headache yesterday - All right "[112-lucy] - for [she]112-lucy had exclaimed indignantly : " [I]112-lucy see it 's much more than headaches . [She]112-lucy watched [him]1771-his steal up [- stairs]1772-- stairs , while the shadows from three banisters passed over [her]112-lucy face like the beat of wings . [She]112-lucy could never marry . In the tumult of [her]112-lucy soul , that stood firm . [Cecil]198-cecil believed in [her]112-lucy ; [she]112-lucy must some day believe in [herself]112-lucy . [She]112-lucy put out the lamp .

It did not do to think , nor , for the matter of that to feel . [She]112-lucy gave up trying to understand [herself]112-lucy , and the vast armies of the benighted , who follow neither the heart nor the brain , and march to [their]1778-their destiny by catch - words . [The armies]1779-the armies are full of [pleasant and pious folk]1780-pleasant and pious folk . But [they]1779-the armies have yielded to the only enemy that matters - the enemy within . [They]1779-the armies have sinned against passion and truth , and vain will be [their]1779-the armies strife after virtue . As the years pass , [they]1779-the armies are censured . [Their]1779-the armies pleasantry and [their]1779-the armies piety show cracks , [their]1779-the armies wit becomes cynicism , [their]1779-the armies unselfishness hypocrisy ; [they]1779-the armies feel and produce discomfort wherever [they]1779-the armies go . [They]1779-the armies have sinned against [Eros]171-eros and against [Pallas Athene]274-pallas athene , and not by any heavenly intervention , but by the ordinary course of nature , [those allied deities]1781-those allied deities will be avenged .

[Lucy]112-lucy entered this army when [she]112-lucy pretended to [George]115-george that [she]112-lucy did not love [him]115-george , and pretended to [Cecil]198-cecil that [she]112-lucy loved [no one]2114-no one . The night received [her]112-lucy , as it had received [Miss Bartlett]111-miss bartlett thirty years before .

Chapter XVIII : Lying to [Mr. Beebe]116-mr. beebe , [Mrs. Honeychurch]152-mrs. honeychurch , [Freddy]121-freddy , and [The Servants

Windy Corner]1783-the servants windy corner lay , not on [the summit of [the ridge]1785-the ridge]1784-the summit of the ridge , but a few hundred feet down [the southern slope]1786-the southern slope , at the springing of one of the great buttresses that supported [the hill]887-the hill . On either side of [it]1788-it was [a shallow ravine , filled with ferns and pine - trees]1789-a shallow ravine , filled with ferns and pine - trees , and down [the ravine on the left]1790-the ravine on the left ran [the highway]1791-the highway into [the Weald]28-the weald .

[Whenever Mr. Beebe]116-mr. beebe crossed [the ridge]1785-the ridge and caught sight of these noble dispositions of [the earth]2229-the earth , and , poised in the middle of them , [Windy Corner]6-windy corner , - [he]116-mr. beebe laughed . The situation was so glorious , [the house]880-the house so commonplace , not to say impertinent . [The late Mr. Honeychurch]222-mr. honeychurch had affected [the cube]1795-the cube , because it gave [him]222-mr. honeychurch the most accommodation for [his]222-mr. honeychurch money , and the only addition made by [[his]222-mr. honeychurch widow]1796-his widow had been [a small turret , shaped like a rhinoceros ' horn , where [she]1796-his widow could sit in wet weather and watch [the carts]1798-the carts going up and down [the road]404-the road]1797-a small turret , shaped like a rhinoceros ' horn , where she could sit in wet weather and watch the carts going up and down the road . So impertinent - and yet [the house]880-the house " did , "[1805-expensive architects] for [it]880-the house was the home of people who loved [[their]1801-their surroundings]1802-their surroundings honestly . [Other houses in [the neighborhood]1804-the neighborhood]1803-other houses in the neighborhood had been built by [expensive architects]1805-expensive architects , over others [[their]1805-expensive architects inmates]1806-their inmates had fidgeted sedulously , yet all these suggested the accidental , the temporary ; while [Windy Corner]6-windy corner seemed as inevitable as an ugliness of Nature 's own creation . [One]2064-one might laugh at [the house]880-the house , but [one]2064-one never shuddered . [Mr. Beebe]116-mr. beebe was bicycling over this Monday afternoon with a piece of gossip . [He]116-mr. beebe had heard from [the Miss Alans]149-the miss alans . [These admirable ladies]1810-these admirable ladies , since [they]1810-these admirable ladies could not go to [Cissie Villa]207-cissie villa , had changed [their]1810-these admirable ladies plans . [They]1810-these admirable ladies were going to [Greece]94-greece instead .

" Since [Florence]14-florence did [[my]144-miss alan poor sister]3247-my poor sister so much good , "[144-miss alan] wrote [Miss Catharine]144-miss alan , " [we]3248-we do not see why [we]3248-we should not try [Athens]39-athens this winter . Of course , [Athens]39-athens is a plunge , and [the doctor]3249-the doctor has ordered [her]3247-my poor sister special digestive bread ; but , after all , [we]3248-we can take that with [us]3248-we , and it is only getting first into [a steamer]3250-a steamer and then into [a train]3251-a train . But is there [an English Church]3252-an english church ? "[144-miss alan] And the letter went on to say : " [I]144-miss alan do not expect [we]3248-we shall go any further than [Athens]39-athens , but if [you]112-lucy knew of a really comfortable pension at [Constantinople]95-constantinople , [we]3248-we should be so grateful . "[144-miss alan]

[Lucy]112-lucy would enjoy this letter , and the smile with which [Mr. Beebe]116-mr. beebe greeted [Windy Corner]6-windy corner was partly for [her]112-lucy . [She]112-lucy would see the fun of it , and some of its beauty , for [she]112-lucy must see some beauty . Though [she]112-lucy was hopeless about pictures , and though [she]112-lucy dressed so unevenly - oh , that cerise frock yesterday at [church]525-church ! - [she]112-lucy must see some beauty in life , or [she]112-lucy could not play the piano as [she]112-lucy did . [He]116-mr. beebe had a theory that [musicians]1812-musicians are incredibly complex , and know far less than [other artists]1813-other artists what [they]1812-musicians want and what [they]1812-musicians are ; that [they]1812-musicians puzzle [themselves]1812-musicians as well as [[their]1812-musicians friends]1814-their friends ; that [their]1812-musicians psychology is a modern development , and has not yet been understood . This theory , had [he]116-mr. beebe known it , had possibly just been illustrated by facts . Ignorant of the events of yesterday [he]116-mr. beebe was only riding over to get some tea , to see [[his]116-mr. beebe niece]1338-his niece , and to observe whether [Miss Honeychurch]112-lucy saw anything beautiful in the desire of [two old ladies]1816-two old ladies to visit [Athens]39-athens .

[A carriage]1817-a carriage was drawn up outside [Windy Corner]6-windy corner , and just as [he]116-mr. beebe caught sight of [the house]880-the house [it]1817-a carriage started , bowled up [the drive]1754-the drive , and stopped abruptly when [it]1817-a carriage reached [the main road]1820-the main road . Therefore it must be the horse , who always expected [people]305-people to walk up [the hill]887-the hill in case [they]305-people tired [him]116-mr. beebe . The door opened obediently , and [two men]1823-two men emerged , whom [Mr. Beebe]116-mr. beebe recognized as [Cecil]198-cecil and [Freddy]121-freddy . [They]1823-two men were [an odd couple to go driving]1824-an odd couple to go driving ; but [he]116-mr. beebe saw a trunk beside [the coachman]1233-the coachman 's legs . [Cecil]198-cecil , who wore a bowler , must be going away , while [Freddy]121-freddy a cap - was seeing [him]116-mr. beebe to [the station]1595-the station . [They]1823-two men walked rapidly , taking the short cuts , and reached [the summit]1827-the summit while [the carriage]865-the carriage was still pursuing the windings of [the road]404-the road .

[They]1823-two men shook hands with [the clergyman]332-the clergyman , but did not speak .

" So [you]198-cecil 're off for a minute , [Mr. Vyse]200-mr. vyse ? "[332-the clergyman] [he]332-the clergyman asked .

[Cecil]198-cecil said , " Yes , "[198-cecil] while [Freddy]121-freddy edged away .

" [I]332-the clergyman was coming to show [you]198-cecil this delightful letter from [those friends of [Miss Honeychurch]112-lucy]3253-those friends of miss honeychurch . "[332-the clergyman] [He]332-the clergyman quoted from it . " Is n't it wonderful ? Is n't it romance ? most certainly [they]3253-those friends of miss honeychurch will go to [Constantinople]95-constantinople . [They]3253-those friends of miss honeychurch are taken in a snare that can not fail . [They]3253-those friends of miss honeychurch will end by going round [the world]2079-the world . "[332-the clergyman]

[Cecil]198-cecil listened civilly , and said [he]198-cecil was sure that [Lucy]112-lucy would be amused and interested .

" Is n't Romance capricious ! [I]198-cecil never notice it in [you]198-cecil [young people]2113-young people ; [you]198-cecil do nothing but play lawn tennis , and say that romance is dead , while [the Miss Alans]149-the miss alans are struggling with all the weapons of propriety against the terrible thing . ' [A really comfortable pension at [Constantinople]95-constantinople]3256-a really comfortable pension at constantinople ! ' So [they]3253-those friends of miss honeychurch call it out of decency , but in [their]3253-those friends of miss honeychurch hearts [they]3253-those friends of miss honeychurch want a pension with magic windows opening on the foam of perilous seas in fairyland forlorn ! No ordinary view will content [the Miss Alans]149-the miss alans . [They]3253-those friends of miss honeychurch want the Pension [Keats]275-keats . "[198-cecil]

" [I]121-freddy 'm awfully sorry to interrupt , [Mr. Beebe]116-mr. beebe , "[121-freddy] said [Freddy]121-freddy , " but have [you]198-cecil any matches ? "[121-freddy]

" [I]198-cecil have , "[198-cecil] said [Cecil]198-cecil , and it did not escape [Mr. Beebe]116-mr. beebe 's notice that [he]116-mr. beebe spoke to [the boy]727-the boy more kindly .

" [You]198-cecil have never met these [Miss Alans]149-the miss alans , have [you]198-cecil , [Mr. Vyse]200-mr. vyse ? "[116-mr. beebe]

" Never . "[198-cecil]

" Then [you]198-cecil do n't see the wonder of this Greek visit . And , [Miss Bartlett]111-miss bartlett not favouring the scheme , [they]1858-we walked up [the hill]887-the hill in a silence which was only broken by [the rector]1320-the rector naming some fern . On the summit [they]1858-we paused . The sky had grown wilder since [he]1320-the rector stood there last hour , giving to [the land]1861-the land a tragic greatness that is rare in [Surrey]29-surrey . Grey clouds were charging across tissues of white , which stretched and shredded and tore slowly , until through their final layers there gleamed a hint of the disappearing blue . Summer was retreating . The wind roared , the trees groaned , yet the noise seemed insufficient for those vast operations in [heaven]2224-heaven . The weather was breaking up , breaking , broken , and it is a sense of the fit rather than of the supernatural that equips such crises with the salvos of angelic artillery . [Mr. Beebe]116-mr. beebe 's eyes rested on [Windy Corner]6-windy corner , where [Lucy]112-lucy sat , practising [Mozart]278-mozart . No smile came to [his]116-mr. beebe lips , and , changing the subject again , [he]116-mr. beebe said : " [We]1858-we sha n't have rain , but [we]1858-we shall have darkness , so let [us]1858-we hurry on . The darkness last night was appalling . "[116-mr. beebe]

[They]1858-we reached [the Beehive Tavern]100-the beehive tavern at about five o'clock . [That amiable hostelry]1863-that amiable hostelry possesses [a verandah]1864-a verandah , in which [the young]1062-the young and the unwise do dearly love to sit , while [guests of more mature years]1866-guests of more mature years seek [a pleasant sanded room]1867-a pleasant sanded room , and have tea at a table comfortably . Chapter XIX : Lying to [Mr. Emerson

The Miss Alans]149-the miss alans were found in [[their]1904-they beloved temperance hotel near [Bloomsbury]101-bloomsbury]1905-their beloved temperance hotel near bloomsbury - [a clean , airless establishment much patronized by [provincial England]1907-provincial england]1906-a clean , airless establishment much patronized by provincial england . [They]1904-they always perched [there]334-there before crossing [the great seas]1909-the great seas , and for a week or two would fidget gently over clothes , guide - books , mackintosh squares , digestive bread , and other Continental necessaries . That there are shops abroad , even in [Athens]39-athens , never occurred to [them]1904-they , for [they]1904-they regarded travel as a species of warfare , only to be undertaken by [those who have been fully armed at [the Haymarket Stores]1911-the haymarket stores]1910-those who have been fully armed at the haymarket stores . [Miss Honeychurch]112-lucy , [they]1904-they trusted , would take care to equip [herself]112-lucy duly . Quinine could now be obtained in tabloids ; paper soap was a great help towards freshening up [one]2064-one 's face in [the train]2549-the train . [Lucy]112-lucy promised , a little depressed .

" But , of course , [you]3317-you know all about these things , and [you]3317-you have [Mr. Vyse]200-mr. vyse to help [you]3317-you . [A gentleman]640-a gentleman is such a stand - by . "[112-lucy]

" [No one]2114-no one will see [Lucy]112-lucy off , "[152-mrs. honeychurch] interposed [Mrs. Honeychurch]152-mrs. honeychurch . " [She]112-lucy does n't like it . "[152-mrs. honeychurch]

[They]1916-the two sisters escaped , and [Lucy]112-lucy said with relief : " That 's all right . [We]1916-the two sisters just got through that time . "[112-lucy]

But [[her]112-lucy mother]442-her mother was annoyed . " [I]442-her mother should be told , [dear]2075-dear , that [I]442-her mother am unsympathetic . [Lucy]112-lucy had plenty to say in reply . [She]112-lucy described [the Miss Alans]149-the miss alans ' character : [they]1918-they were [such gossips]1919-such gossips , and if [one]2064-one told [them]1918-they , the news would be everywhere in no time .

" But why should n't it be everywhere in no time ? "[112-lucy]

" Because [I]112-lucy settled with [Cecil]198-cecil not to announce it until [I]112-lucy left [England]13-england . [I]112-lucy shall tell [them]1922-them then . It 's much pleasanter . How wet it is ! Let 's turn in here . "[112-lucy]

" [Here]2059-here "[112-lucy] was [the British Museum]1921-the british museum . [Mrs. Honeychurch]152-mrs. honeychurch refused . If [they]1922-them must take shelter , let it be in [a shop]1923-a shop . [Lucy]112-lucy felt contemptuous , for [she]112-lucy was on the tack of caring for Greek sculpture , and had already borrowed a mythical dictionary from [Mr. Beebe]116-mr. beebe to get up the names of the goddesses and gods .

" [You]112-lucy know , [Lucy]112-lucy , [you]112-lucy and [Charlotte]111-miss bartlett and [Mr. Beebe]116-mr. beebe all tell [me]112-lucy [I]112-lucy 'm so stupid , so [I]112-lucy suppose [I]112-lucy am , but [I]112-lucy shall never understand this hole - and - corner work . [You]112-lucy 've got rid of [Cecil]198-cecil - well and good , and [I]112-lucy 'm thankful [he]198-cecil 's gone , though [I]112-lucy did feel angry for the minute . But why not announce it ?
